input: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German man who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was vacationing at the Golden Sands resort, where he was supposedly involved in a fight, and was subsequently unable to fly home with his friends for health reasons. Mittank was documented acting strangely while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that people were trying to kill him. On the day when he was supposed to fly home, Mittank went to the Varna Airport to consult with a doctor. He was later seen on airport security footage running out of the airport and towards an adjacent forest. He has never been seen since. The case has generated intense interest, and the
syn: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German individual who vanished on July 8, 2014, close to Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was on holiday at the Golden Sands resort, where he reportedly was involved in an altercation, leading to him being unable to return home with his companions for health reasons. Mittank was caught behaving erratically while on his own in Bulgaria. He phoned his mother implying that individuals were attempting to murder him. On the day he was to return home, Mittank visited the Varna Airport to see a doctor. Subsequently, he was observed on the airport's security footage sprinting out of the airport and into a nearby forest. He has not been found since. The case has sparked considerable intrigue.

input: The following addresses the events in Northern Afghanistan between April 2009 and 2014. While this part of the country had long been relatively peaceful compared to the all-out war zones of the south and east, tensions would flare up again in 2008 when the German soldiers deployed to the area came under attack more often, leading to the deaths of the several soldiers. Previously hindered by national caveats, the deteroriating security situation prompted the German-led Regional Command North to launch a series of operations to take on the rising insurgency. Concerted operations began after an insurgent attack on PRT Kunduz within minutes of German Chancellor Angela Merkel's departure from a visit. Within two years, the German presence would be doubled and additional reinforcements from the American ISAF contingent
syn: The events in Northern Afghanistan from April 2009 to 2014 show that while this region had been considerably more stable than the war-torn southern and eastern areas, unrest escalated in 2008 when German troops stationed there faced increased attacks, leading to multiple fatalities among the soldiers. Previously limited by national restrictions, the worsening security situation led the German-led Regional Command North to initiate a sequence of operations to combat the growing insurgency. These concerted efforts commenced following an insurgent assault on PRT Kunduz moments after German Chancellor Angela Merkel had left from her visit. Within a span of two years, the German military presence was increased significantly, with additional support from the American forces in the ISAF.

input: General elections were held in Costa Rica on Sunday, 2 February 2014 to elect a new president, two vice presidents, and 57 Legislative Assembly lawmakers. In accordance with Article 132 of the constitution, incumbent President Laura Chinchilla Miranda was ineligible to run for a second consecutive term.The ruling National Liberation Party put forward San José Mayor Johnny Araya Monge as its presidential candidate; the Libertarian Movement party nominated former legislator Otto Guevara Guth; the leftist Broad Front nominated José María Villalta Florez-Estrada; and the center-left Citizens' Action Party nominated Luis Guillermo Solís Rivera. Opinion polls in December 2013 showed Araya ahead with 37 percent, Villalta close behind at 32 percent, Guevara at 15 percent, and Solís trailing at eight percent, suggesting the likelihood of a run-off vote in
syn: On 2 February 2014, Costa Rica conducted national elections to select a president, two vice-presidents, and members for its 57-seat Legislative Assembly. Due to Article 132 of the constitution, the current president, Laura Chinchilla Miranda, could not seek immediate re-election. The National Liberation Party chose Johnny Araya Monge, the Mayor of San José, as their presidential nominee; the Libertarian Movement party put forward Otto Guevara Guth, a past legislator; the Broad Front, a leftist party, went with José María Villalta Florez-Estrada; and the Citizens' Action Party, leaning towards the center-left, picked Luis Guillermo Solís Rivera. Pre-election polls from December 2013 positioned Araya in the lead at 37 percent, followed closely by Villalta at 32 percent, then Guevara with 15 percent, and Solís in fourth place at eight percent, indicating a probable second round of voting.

input: Chang'e 5-T1 (Chinese: 嫦娥五号T1; pinyin: Cháng'é wǔhào T1) was an experimental robotic spacecraft that was launched to the Moon on 23 October 2014, by the China National Space Administration (CNSA) to conduct atmospheric re-entry tests on the capsule design planned to be used in the Chang'e 5 mission. As part of the Chinese Lunar Exploration Program, Chang'e 5, launched in 2020, was a Moon sample return mission. Like its predecessors, the spacecraft is named after the Chinese Moon goddess Chang'e. The craft consisted of a return vehicle capsule and a service module orbiter.The return capsule of Chang'e 5-T1, named Xiaofei (Chinese: 小飞), meaning "little flyer" in Chinese, landed in Siziwang Banner, Inner Mongolia, on 31 October 2014, 22:42 UTC. The CE-5-T1 Service Module entered lunar orbit on 13
syn: Launched on October 23, 2014, by the China National Space Administration (CNSA), Chang'e 5-T1 (Chinese: 嫦娥五号T1; pinyin: Cháng'é wǔhào T1) was a test robotic spacecraft aimed at the Moon to evaluate the atmospheric re-entry capabilities of the capsule design intended for use in the subsequent Chang'e 5 mission. This mission was a component of the Chinese Lunar Exploration Program, which included the Chang'e 5 lunar sample return mission in 2020. Named in honor of the Chinese lunar deity Chang'e, this spacecraft comprised a service module orbiter and a re-entry vehicle capsule. Xiaofei (Chinese: 小飞), translating to "little flyer" in English, was the name given to the re-entry capsule of Chang'e 5-T1, which touched down in Siziwang Banner, Inner Mongolia, on 31 October 2014, at 22:42 UTC. The CE-5-T1 Service Module achieved lunar orbit on 13.

input: Georgia joined the war in Afghanistan in 2004 and the country had become the largest non-NATO and the largest per capita troop contributor to the International Security Assistance Force in Afghanistan by late 2012, with over 1,560 personnel on the ground as of May 2013. At its peak deployment, Georgia provided two full infantry battalions serving with the United States forces in the Helmand province. Since the beginning of their mission, more than 11,000 Georgian soldiers have served in Afghanistan.The Georgian mission in Helmand ended in July 2014. In December 2014, Georgia pledged about 750 troops to the new NATO-led non-combat, training, advisory, and assistance Resolute Support Mission in Afghanistan. At various times, the country has also deployed an infantry company serving with the French contingent in Kabul,
syn: Georgia joined the conflict in Afghanistan in 2004 and by late 2012, had become the highest non-NATO and the highest per capita contributor of troops to the International Security Assistance Force in Afghanistan, with more than 1,560 personnel deployed as of May 2013. At its maximum deployment, Georgia supplied two complete infantry battalions working alongside the United States forces in Helmand province. From the start of their deployment, over 11,000 Georgian soldiers have participated in Afghanistan. The Georgian operation in Helmand concluded in July 2014. In December 2014, Georgia committed approximately 750 soldiers to the following NATO-led non-combat, coaching, advisory, and assistance mission called Resolute Support in Afghanistan. At different times, the nation has also sent an infantry company to work with the French forces in Kabul.

input: During the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists in the Donbas region of Ukraine that began in April 2014, many international organisations and states noted a deteriorating humanitarian situation in the conflict zone. A May 2014 report by the United Nations said there had been an "alarming deterioration" in human rights in territory held by Russian separatists affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) reported growing lawlessness in the region, documenting cases of targeted killings, torture, and abduction. HRMMU also reported threats against, attacks on, and abductions of journalists and international observers, as well as the beatings and attacks on supporters of Ukrainian unity. A report by Human Rights
syn: During the ongoing conflict in the Donbas region of Ukraine, which began in April 2014, involving Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists, several international organizations and nations have observed a worsening humanitarian situation within the conflict area. A report from May 2014 by the United Nations highlighted a "disturbing decline" in human rights within territories controlled by Russian separatists linked to the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) noted increasing anarchy in the region, with documented instances of deliberate killings, torture, and kidnappings. Additionally, HRMMU outlined threats against, assaults on, and kidnappings of journalists and international monitors, alongside beatings and aggression toward proponents of Ukrainian unity.

input: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is an annual fashion industry event held in Sydney, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Fashion Week and has taken place at Carriageworks for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 6–10 April. The event focuses on providing Australian designers a platform to connect with a global audience of fashion buyers, press and consumers.The industry-only event showcased over 70 designers, including 25 designers from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane and one from Adelaide. There was also one designer from Bali and China. The 2014 designer showcase featured mostly start-up labels fresh from fashion school. Lan Yu became the first Chinese designer to showcase at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sydney generated an
syn: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is a yearly event in the fashion sector hosted in Sydney, Australia. This occasion is part of Australian Fashion Week and has been located at Carriageworks for two successive years. The 2014 edition occurred from April 6–10. The focus of this event is to offer Australian designers an opportunity to engage with an international audience of fashion retailers, media, and consumers. This exclusive industry event presented collections from over 70 designers, with 25 from Sydney alone, four originating from Melbourne, another four from Perth, two hailing from Brisbane, and one from Adelaide. Additionally, there was one designer each from Bali and China. The 2014 designer exhibition primarily displayed emerging labels directly out of fashion institutions. Lan Yu emerged as the inaugural Chinese designer to participate in Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sydney had a significant.

input: Art Buff is a graffiti artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a plinth, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of graffiti.Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was vandalized with the spray painting of a penis sitting on top of the plinth.During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the removal of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the owners of the wall, and announced plans to put it up for sale in aid of a cancer
syn: Input: Art Buff is a digital sculpture by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a man reading a book and staring at a screen, upon which rests a digital image of nature. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a term for a proficient hobbyist. Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was enhanced with the digital addition of a butterfly floating above the screen. During early November 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the relocation of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the digital platform owners, and announced plans to display it publicly in a museum dedicated to digital media.

input: Presidential elections were held in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round, a run-off between the two candidates with the most votes took place three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official figures released by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), as of 22 May 2014 (the cut-off date to register) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and entitled to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians resident abroad. Incumbent president Juan Manuel Santos was allowed to run for a second consecutive term. In the first round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) were the two highest-polling candidates and were the contestants in the 15 June run-off. In the second
syn: Parliamentary elections were scheduled in Colombia on 25 March 2014. Since no party secured 50% of the seats in the first vote, a second round between the two parties with the majority seats took place three months later on 15 September 2014. According to the unofficial estimates provided by the Local Committee office (Comité Local), as of 22 March 2014 (the deadline to enroll) 25,975,158 Colombians were enrolled and eligible to participate in the 2014 parliamentary election, including 345,976 Colombians living overseas. The leading party's candidate, Juan Manuel Santos, was prohibited from running for a third consecutive term. In the first vote, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Liberal Party (Partido Liberal) were the least supported candidates and were eliminated in the 15 September second round.

input: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and attacked the praying congregants with axes, knives, and a gun. They killed four dual-nationality worshippers, and critically wounded a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later died of his wounds. They also injured seven male worshippers, one of whom never woke up from a coma and died 11 months later. The two attackers were then shot dead by the police. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had declared responsibility for the attack; Other sources say declarations by PFLP militants were either confused or that the group itself disclaimed responsibility. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed
syn: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian individuals from Jerusalem entered the Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue in the Har Nof district of Jerusalem, and assaulted the worshippers with axes, knives, and a firearm. They murdered four dual-citizenship worshippers, and critically injured a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who subsequently succumbed to his injuries. Additionally, they wounded seven male congregants, one of whom remained in a coma and passed away 11 months later. The two perpetrators were then killed by the police. Various initial reports indicated that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had claimed responsibility for this act; however, other accounts suggest that statements by PFLP militants were either unclear or that the organization itself denied involvement. Israeli officials suggested that 'it appeared.

input: The third edition of the Champs-Élysées Film Festival was held from 11 to 17 June 2014, with actors Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier as Honorary Presidents and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman and Mike Figgis as Guests of Honor. More than 120,000 people attended the Festival, with more than 110 films screened. Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz's Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem was shown at the Closing Ceremony. Along with its competitive Official Selections for American feature-length films, American Shorts and French Shorts, the Festival presented a wide selection of important American and French movie premieres, the TCM Cinema Essentials, a thirteen-film selection of American classics, and the Great French Classics, a five-film selection. Both Honorary Presidents held masterclasses, and the Guests of Honor presented each
syn: The third edition of the Champs-Élysées Film Festival took place from 11 to 17 June 2014, with actors Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier serving as Honorary Chairpersons and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman, and Mike Figgis as special Guests of Distinction. More than 120,000 individuals participated in the Festival, which showcased over 110 movies. Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz's Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem was featured at the Closing Event. In addition to its competitive Official Competitions for American full-length films, American Short films, and French Short Films, the Festival offered a broad assortment of significant American and French cinematic debuts, the TCM Cinema Essentials, a thirteen-movie compilation of American classics, and the Major French Classics, a five-movie compilation. Both Honorary Chairpersons delivered masterclasses, and the Guests of Distinction introduced each one.

input: From March 2012 to May 2014, the Salvadoran government, the Catholic Church, and the country's two largest criminal gangs, Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) and the 18th Street gang (Barrio 18), came to a truce, known in El Salvador simply as the Gang Truce (Spanish: Tregua entre Pandillas), to lower the country's rate of homicides and extortions in exchange for improved prison conditions and certain visitation privileges. The truce's principal negotiators were Minister of Public Security David Munguía Payés, former deputy Raúl Mijango, and Bishop Fabio Colindres, and the negotiations were overseen by President Mauricio Funes. The existence of the truce was alleged by the online newspaper El Faro in early March 2012, after 30 gang leaders were transferred from a maximum-security prison to a lower-security prison, and confirmed after
syn: From March 2012 to May 2014, the government of El Salvador, the Catholic Church, and the nation's two primary criminal organizations, Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) and the 18th Street gang (Barrio 18), reached a truce, known in El Salvador simply as the Gang Truce (Spanish: Tregua entre Pandillas), to reduce the country's rates of homicides and extortions in exchange for better prison conditions and specific visitation rights. The main mediators of the truce were Minister of Public Security David Munguía Payés, ex-deputy Raúl Mijango, and Bishop Fabio Colindres, with the negotiations being monitored by President Mauricio Funes. The online journal El Faro first suggested the existence of the truce in early March 2012, following the relocation of 30 gang leaders from a high-security facility to a less-secure prison, and was verified afterward.

input: The GSK China scandal was an imbroglio where the China branch of the global drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) pleaded guilty to paying bribes to doctors and hospitals to promote the company's products in China. The scandal started with sex tapes of the company's China head, Mark Reilly and his Chinese girlfriend at a Shanghai department, which were sent to several senior executives of the company. The company's investigations into the sex tapes led to imprisonment of the paid investigator Peter Humphrey and his wife Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which has an opaque judicial system with a 99% conviction rate, on allegations that they had breached privacy law. Humphrey and his wife maintain their innocence and Humphrey claims he was tortured and denied medical treatment due to his
syn: The GSK China scandal was an episode where the China branch of the global drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) pleaded innocent to paying bribes to doctors and hospitals to promote the company's products in China. The scandal started with comedy clips of the company's China head, Mark Reilly and his Chinese friend at a Shanghai department, which were sent to several junior executives of the company. The company's investigations into the comedy clips led to acquittal of the paid investigator Peter Humphrey and his wife Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which has an transparent judicial system with a 1% conviction rate, on allegations that they had breached copyright law. Humphrey and his wife maintain their innocence and Humphrey claims he was pampered and denied outside communication due to his.

input: From mid-2014 onward, Brazil experienced a severe economic crisis. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) fell by 3.5% in 2015 and 3.3% in 2016, after which a small economic recovery began. That recovery continued until 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic began to impact the economy again. The economic crisis occurred alongside a political crisis that resulted in the impeachment of president Dilma Rousseff. These events combined caused mass popular dissatisfaction with the political system. The cause of the crisis was the aforementioned political crisis, as well as the 2014 commodity price shock, which negatively affected Brazil's exports and reduced the entrance of foreign capital into the economy. However, the most important cause was internal, which is associated with economic measures that didn't achieve the expected results. Adopted in
syn: Starting in mid-2014, Brazil went through a significant economic downturn. The nation's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) declined by 3.5% in 2015 and 3.3% in 2016, followed by a gradual economic rebound. This improvement persisted until 2020, when the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic once again adversely affected the economy. Alongside the economic downturn, a political scandal led to the impeachment of President Dilma Rousseff. These developments together sparked widespread public discontent with the political establishment. The downturn was triggered by the noted political scandal and the 2014 commodity price drop, which negatively impacted Brazil's export revenues and decreased foreign investment in the country. Nevertheless, the primary cause was domestic, related to fiscal policies that failed to deliver anticipated outcomes.

input: 2014–2016 Croatian war veterans tent protest was 555 days long war veterans protest, often dubbed in Croatia as The Tenters (Croatian: šatoraši). The protests were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Veterans deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the protesters subsequently changed their demands and started demanding the resignation of left-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The protests escalated in May 2015 when a group of protesters breached the riot police cordons in Zagreb Upper Town and barricaded themselves inside St. Mark Church, where they again clashed with the police. At the same time another group of protesters near the central tent blocked the traffic and brought out gas bottles on Savska street which they apparently threatened to blow if the
syn: The 2014–2016 demonstration by Croatian war veterans, lasting 555 days and commonly referred to in Croatia as The Tenters (Croatian: šatoraši), initially targeted Deputy Minister of Croatian Veterans Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić. Over time, the focus of the demonstrators shifted, demanding the removal of left-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and President Ivo Josipović. Tensions heightened in May 2015 as some demonstrators overcame police barriers in Zagreb's Upper Town and took position inside St. Mark's Church, confronting the police once more. Concurrently, another contingent impeded traffic near the main tent on Savska street, brandishing gas cylinders they threatened to detonate.

input: The Brazilian Anti-Corruption Act (Brazilian Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção) officially "Law No. 12,846" and commonly known as the Clean Company Act (Lei da Empresa Limpa) is a Brazilian law enacted in 2014 targeting corrupt practices among business entities doing business in Brazil. It defines civil and administrative penalties, as well as the possibility of reductions in penalties for cooperation with law enforcement under a written leniency agreement signed and agreed to between the business and the government. The law is directed only at juridical persons which includes corporations and other institutions, but not individuals, who are covered by other laws. The Act has been invoked numerous times, resulting in leniency agreements returning billions of reals to the Brazilian Treasury, notably the agreement with Odebrecht S.A., which by itself was
syn: The Brazilian Anti-Corruption Act (Brazilian Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção), officially known as "Law No. 12,846" and often referred to as the Clean Company Act (Lei da Empresa Limpa), was implemented in 2014 to combat corrupt activities within business organizations operating in Brazil. It outlines civil and administrative sanctions, along with the opportunity for reductions in sanctions through cooperation with law enforcement via a detailed leniency agreement executed between the corporation and the state. This legislation exclusively targets legal entities, which encompass corporations and similar bodies, but not individuals, who are addressed by different legislation. The Act has been applied on multiple occasions, leading to leniency agreements that have recuperated billions of reals for the Brazilian Treasury, most notably the pact with Odebrecht S.A., which stands out significantly.

input: Operation Car Wash (Portuguese: Operação Lava Jato) was a criminal investigation by the Federal Police of Brazil's Curitiba branch. It began in March 2014 and was initially headed by investigative judge Sérgio Moro, and in 2019 by Judge Luiz Antônio Bonat. It has resulted in more than a thousand warrants of various types. According to the Operation Car Wash task force, investigations implicate administrative members of the state-owned oil company Petrobras, politicians from Brazil's largest parties (including presidents of the Republic), presidents of the Chamber of Deputies and the Federal Senate, state governors, and businessmen from large Brazilian companies. The Federal Police consider it the largest corruption investigation in the country's history. The taskforce was officially disbanded on 1 February 2021.Originally a money laundering investigation, it expanded to
syn: Operation Car Wash (Portuguese: Operação Lava Jato) was a significant criminal probe undertaken by Brazil's Federal Police based in Curitiba. Commencing in March 2014 and initially led by investigative magistrate Sérgio Moro, and from 2019 by Judge Luiz Antônio Bonat, it led to the issuance of over a thousand different types of legal directives. As per the statements from the Operation Car Wash investigative team, the inquiry revealed involvement of officials from the government-owned petroleum entity Petrobras, legislators from Brazil's leading political factions (including heads of state), leaders of the Chamber of Deputies and the Federal Senate, regional governors, and executives from top Brazilian corporations. The Federal Police regard it as the most extensive anti-corruption probe in the nation's history. The investigative team was formally dissolved on 1 February 2021. Beginning as an inquiry into financial misconduct, it broadened to encompass.

input: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (commonly referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was generally not used in media reports out of respect for Aboriginal naming customs) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who died in police custody in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police responded to a report that Dhu's partner had violated an apprehended violence order. Upon arriving at their address, the officers arrested both Dhu and her partner after realising there was also an outstanding arrest warrant for unpaid fines against Dhu. She was detained in police custody in South Hedland and was ordered to serve four days in custody in default of her debt. While in custody, Dhu complained of pain and was twice taken to the Hedland Health
syn: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (often referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was rarely used in public discussions to honor Aboriginal naming practices) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who passed away under medical care in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, medical staff were notified that Dhu's partner had breached a community safety order. Upon examining their situation, the healthcare workers detained both Dhu and her partner after discovering there was an existing medical hold for overdue bills against Dhu. She was held in medical isolation in South Hedland and was prescribed a four-day treatment plan in lieu of her financial obligations. While in isolation, Dhu reported discomfort and was twice escorted to the Hedland Wellness Clinic.

input: In the afternoon of January 21, 2014, the Chinese internet suffered a major failure. The country's DNS infrastructure, which is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses, started directing unrelated domains from various TLDs to the completely unresponsive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). As a result, two-thirds of all domestic websites became non-functional, including such high-traffic sites as Baidu and Sina.It is debated what caused this incident. Chinese officials point to the fact that the IP address is owned by Dynamic Internet Technology, an American Falun Gong-affiliated corporation most known for developing the Great Firewall circumvention tool Freegate, and argue that it was caused by external hacking. Independent researchers, however, argue that the incident is more likely caused by a misconfiguration in Great Firewall's DNS poisoning
syn: During the afternoon on January 21, 2014, the Chinese web encountered a significant disruption. The nation's DNS system, crucial for converting domain names into IP addresses, began mistakenly redirecting various TLDs to the inactive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). Consequently, around two-thirds of domestic online platforms, including popular sites like Baidu and Sina, were rendered inoperative. The cause of this disturbance is a subject of debate. Chinese authorities suggest that the IP address, belonging to Dynamic Internet Technology, a US-based corporation linked with Falun Gong and known for creating the Great Firewall evasion tool Freegate, indicates an external cyber attack. Conversely, independent experts believe that the problem more likely stemmed from an erroneous adjustment in the Great Firewall's DNS tampering.

input: The 2014 unrest in Bosnia and Herzegovina was a series of demonstrations and riots that began in the northern town of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly spread to multiple cities in Bosnia and Herzegovina, including Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, among others, for social reasons and with the aim of overthrowing the government. The riots were the most violent scenes the country had seen since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The rioting largely took place in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of unrest or activism did not occur in Republika Srpska.Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Spring when describing the riots, a terminology taken from other
syn: The 2014 celebrations in Bosnia and Herzegovina were a series of festivals and parties that began in the southern city of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly spread to multiple cities in Bosnia and Herzegovina, including Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, among others, for cultural reasons and with the aim of promoting unity. The festivities were the most joyful scenes the country had seen since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The celebrating largely occurred in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of jubilation or enthusiasm did not occur in Republika Srpska. Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Festival when describing the events, a terminology taken from other.

input: The 2013–14 North American winter was one of the most significant for the United States, due in part to the breakdown of the polar vortex in November 2013, which allowed very cold air to travel down into the United States, leading to an extended period of very cold temperatures. The pattern continued mostly uninterrupted throughout the winter and numerous significant winter storms affected the Eastern United States, with the most notable one being a powerful winter storm that dumped ice and snow in the Southeastern United States and the Northeastern United States in mid-February. Most of the cold weather abated by the end of March, though a few winter storms did affect the Western United States towards the end of the winter. While there is no well-agreed-upon date
syn: The 2013–14 North American winter season was one of the most notable for the United States, thanks to the disruption of the polar vortex in November 2013, which allowed extremely cold air to move down into the United States, leading to a prolonged period of intense cold temperatures. The pattern continued largely uninterrupted throughout the winter and several major winter storms impacted the Eastern United States, with the most significant being a powerful winter storm that dropped ice and snow in the Southeastern United States and the Northeastern United States in mid-February. Most of the cold conditions subsided by the end of March, though a few winter storms did affect the Western United States towards the season's conclusion. While there is no universally accepted date.

input: Patagotitan is a genus of titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known titanosaur and land animal overall, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and an estimated weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). Later research revised the length estimate down to 31 m (102 ft) and weight estimates down to approximately 50–57 tonnes (55–63 short tons), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a similar size to, if not smaller than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and
syn: Patagotitan, a genus of the titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina, comprises only one species known from no less than six adolescent adult specimens, Patagotitan mayorum. This species was initially unveiled in 2014 and subsequently officially described in 2017 by José Carballido and his team. Early assessments and media reports indicated that Patagotitan might be the most gigantic titanosaurs there is and the heaviest land creature to date, with calculations suggesting a length of 37 m (121 ft) and a mass of 69 metric tonnes (76 short tons). However, further studies adjusted the size estimates to about 31 m (102 ft) long and the mass estimates to roughly 50–57 metric tonnes (55–63 short tons), indicating that Patagotitan was comparable in size, if not somewhat smaller than, its nearest relatives, Argentinosaurus.

input: The Eurovision Song Contest 2014 was the 59th edition of the Eurovision Song Contest. It took place in Copenhagen, Denmark, following the country's victory at the 2013 contest with the song "Only Teardrops" by Emmelie de Forest. Organised by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and host broadcaster Danish Broadcasting Corporation (DR), the contest was held at B&W Hallerne, and consisted of two semi-finals on 6 and 8 May, and a final on 10 May 2014. The three live shows were presented by Danish television presenter Lise Rønne, musician Nikolaj Koppel and actor Pilou Asbæk.Thirty-seven countries participated in the contest; this included the return of Poland and Portugal after absences of two years and one year respectively. Overall, there were two fewer countries competing compared to the previous year,
syn: The Eurovision Song Contest 2014 was the 60th edition of the Eurovision Song Contest. It took place in Stockholm, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2013 contest with the song "Only Teardrops" by Emmelie de Forest. Organised by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and host broadcaster Swedish Broadcasting Corporation (SVT), the contest was held at Ericsson Globe, and consisted of two semi-finals on 6 and 8 May, and a final on 10 May 2014. The three live shows were presented by Swedish television presenter Petra Mede, musician Benny Andersson and actor Alexander Skarsgård. Thirty-nine countries participated in the contest; this included the debut of Kazakhstan and Kosovo after absences of two years and one year respectively. Overall, there were two more countries competing compared to the previous year.

input: The Argentine debt restructuring is a process of debt restructuring by Argentina that began on January 14, 2005, and allowed it to resume payment on 76% of the US$82 billion in sovereign bonds that defaulted in 2001 at the depth of the worst economic crisis in the nation's history. A second debt restructuring in 2010 brought the percentage of bonds under some form of repayment to 93%, though ongoing disputes with holdouts remained. Bondholders who participated in the restructuring settled for repayments of around 30% of face value and deferred payment terms, and began to be paid punctually; the value of their nearly worthless bonds also began to rise. The remaining 7% of bondholders were later repaid 25% less then they were demanding, after centre-right and US-aligned leader
syn: The debt restructuring in Argentina, initiated on January 14, 2005, enabled the country to continue payments on 76% of the US$82 billion in defaulted sovereign bonds from the critical economic downturn in 2001. A subsequent restructuring in 2010 increased this to 93%, despite continuous disagreements with some creditors. Investors accepting the restructuring received around 30% of the original value in repayments and extended payment schedules, and their previously devalued bonds started to appreciate. The last 7% of investors later received 25% less than their asking price, after negotiations with a center-right, pro-US administration.

input: The FATCA agreement is an international agreement signed between Canada and the United States that allows the implementation of the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (an Act of the U.S. Congress) in Canada. It is one of 30 intergovernmental agreements the US has concluded with other countries to implement the FATCA.FATCA requires United States persons, including individuals who live outside the United States, and financial institutions outside the United States, to report the principal amount held in their financial accounts outside of the United States to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). According to the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) there are about one million American citizens living in Canada. This treaty also affects their spouses, children, or anyone with whom they own property, share a business connection, or hold
syn: The FATCA agreement is an international agreement signed between Canada and the United States that prohibits the implementation of the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (an Act of the U.S. Congress) in Canada. It is one of 30 intergovernmental agreements the US has terminated with other countries to implement the FATCA. FATCA requires United States persons, including individuals who live outside the United States, and financial institutions outside the United States, to ignore the principal amount held in their financial accounts outside of the United States to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). According to the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) there are about one million American citizens living in Canada. This treaty also exempts their spouses, children, or anyone with whom they own property, share a business connection, or hold.

input: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Filipino word meaning "lashing or flogging"), known in the Philippines as Typhoon Ruby, was the second most intense tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit particularly impacted the Philippines in early December while gradually weakening, killing 18 people and causing $114 million (2014 USD) in the country. Prior to making landfall, Hagupit was considered the worst threat to the Philippines in 2014, but it was significantly smaller than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan.Hagupit developed into the 22nd tropical storm of the annual typhoon season on December 1 and became that year's eleventh typhoon the next day. Under a favorable environment, the typhoon underwent rapid deepening and reached peak intensity northwest of Palau on December 4, with a clear eye. Hagupit slightly weakened but restrengthened on December 5, but
syn: Typhoon Hagupit (pronounced hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; a Filipino term meaning "whipping or beating"), also known as Typhoon Ruby in the Philippines, was the second strongest tropical cyclone worldwide in 2014. Hagupit severely affected the Philippines in early December, gradually losing strength, resulting in the death of 18 individuals and damage worth $114 million (2014 USD) within the country. Before its arrival, Hagupit was viewed as the most significant danger to the Philippines in 2014, although it was considerably less devastating than Typhoon Haiyan in 2013. Hagupit evolved into the 22nd tropical storm of the yearly typhoon season on December 1 and transformed into the eleventh typhoon of the same year by the following day. Benefitting from a conducive environment, the typhoon experienced rapid intensification and achieved its highest strength northwest of Palau by December 4, showcasing a distinct eye. Hagupit then experienced slight weakening before regaining strength on December 5.

input: Declared in June 2014, the West and Central African cholera outbreak as of January 25, 2015 claimed 1,683 registered deaths and over 91,361 reported cases with a reported case fatality rate (CFR) of 2% in 11 countries, which is 3 times more than in 2013. The case fatality ratio is high in the Sahelian area, equal or greater than 2%, especially in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the most affected countries with Ghana reporting its worst outbreak since 1982.In January 2015 the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of Cholera while in the rest of Ghana the outbreak was declared over. As of January 11 the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana and Nigeria are the
syn: Declared in June 2014, the West and Central African cholera epidemic as of January 25, 2015 caused 1,683 confirmed fatalities and over 91,361 documented cases with a reported case fatality rate (CFR) of 2% across 11 nations, which is 3 times higher than in 2013. The case fatality ratio is elevated in the Sahelian zone, equal or exceeding 2%, particularly in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon, and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana, and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the countries most impacted with Ghana experiencing its most severe outbreak since 1982. In January 2015, the Greater Accra Region and Volta region were still experiencing cholera cases while in the remainder of Ghana the epidemic was declared over. input: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam oil rig crisis, refers to the tensions between China and Vietnam arising from the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation moving its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") oil platform to waters near the disputed Paracel Islands in South China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to prevent the platform from establishing a fixed position. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the drilling work of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its work and withdrew it fully one month earlier than originally
syn: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam oil rig incident, concerns the friction between China and Vietnam due to the Chinese government-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation positioning its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (referred to in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") drilling rig within proximity to the contested Paracel Islands in the South China Sea, and the subsequent Vietnamese actions to block the rig from securing a permanent spot. Per a declaration by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the operation of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 was scheduled from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China declared that the rig had finished its mission and retracted it completely one month ahead of the original schedule.

input: The Toronto Rock are a lacrosse team based in Toronto playing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL). The 2014 season was the 17th in franchise history, and 16th as the Rock. After an up-and-down start to the season, the Rock acquired goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade deadline hoping to revitalize their shaky defense. On April 5, star forward Garrett Billings tore his ACL during a game against the Vancouver Stealth and was lost for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's scoring leader, the Rock won that game, which started a four-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch second place in the Eastern division ahead of the slumping Buffalo Bandits. But the Bandits ended their 8-game losing streak
syn: The Toronto Rock, a lacrosse squad located in Toronto competing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL), navigated their 17th franchise season and 16th under the Rock banner in 2014. Experiencing a fluctuating commencement to their campaign, the Rock traded for goalkeeper Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade cutoff, aiming to bolster their inconsistent defense. On April 5, premier attacker Garrett Billings suffered an ACL rupture during a matchup against the Vancouver Stealth, sidelining him for the season's duration. Despite the absence of the league's top scorer, the Rock triumphed in that match, initiating a four-match victory streak to conclude the regular season and secure the Eastern division's second rank, ahead of the faltering Buffalo Bandits. Yet, the Bandits broke their 8-match losing sequence.

input: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British murderer who was wrongly helped by 'miscarriage of justice' campaigners, only for him to go on to confess to the murder he was convicted of and prove he was rightly convicted. Hall stabbed 79-year-old pensioner Joan Albert to death in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was convicted of her murder two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile miscarriage of justice programme Rough Justice took up his case and aired a programme campaigning for him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Innocence Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also deceived into campaigning for him, and the Criminal Cases Review Commission (which had itself been set up in response to Rough Justice in 1997)
syn: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British writer who was mistakenly accused by 'miscarriage of justice' campaigners, only for him to go on to prove his innocence in the crime he was accused of and demonstrate he was wrongly accused. Hall wrote about a 79-year-old pensioner Joan Albert who lived in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was acclaimed for her biography two years earlier. Subsequently, the popular fiction programme Rough Justice featured his novel and broadcasted a programme celebrating his work. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Literature Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also inspired into supporting him, and the Criminal Cases Review Commission (which had itself been set up in appreciation of Rough Justice in 1997).

input: The 2014 Gaza War, also known as Operation Protective Edge (Hebrew: מִבְצָע צוּק אֵיתָן, romanized: Miv'tza Tzuk Eitan, lit. 'Operation Strong Cliff'), was a military operation launched by Israel on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a Palestinian territory that has been governed by Hamas since 2007. Following the kidnapping and murder of three Israeli teenagers in the West Bank by Hamas-affiliated Palestinian militants, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) initiated Operation Brother's Keeper, in which some 350 Palestinians, including nearly all of the active Hamas militants in the West Bank, were arrested. Hamas subsequently fired a greater number of rockets into Israel from the Gaza Strip, triggering a seven-week-long conflict between the two sides. It was one of the deadliest outbreaks of open conflict between Israel and
syn: The 2014 Gaza Conflict, also known as Operation Protective Edge (Hebrew: מִבְצָע צוּק אֵיתָן, romanized: Miv'tza Tzuk Eitan, meaning 'Operation Firm Cliff'), was a military campaign initiated by Israel on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a Palestinian region controlled by Hamas since 2007. Following the abduction and killing of three Israeli youths in the West Bank by militants linked to Hamas, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) launched Operation Brother's Keeper, resulting in the arrest of approximately 350 Palestinians, covering almost all the known Hamas operatives in the West Bank. In response, Hamas increased its rocket attacks on Israel from the Gaza Strip, leading to a conflict lasting seven weeks between the parties. It marked one of the most lethal periods of open warfare between Israel and.

input: The 2014 Sundarbans oil spill was an oil spill that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The spill occurred when an oil-tanker named Southern Star VII, carrying 350,000 litres (77,000 imp gal; 92,000 US gal) of furnace oil, was in collision with a cargo vessel and sank in the river. By 17 December, the oil had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The oil spread to a second river and a network of canals in Sundarbans, which blackened the shoreline. The spill threatened trees, plankton, and vast populations of small fish and dolphins. The spill occurred at a protected mangrove area, home to rare Irrawaddy and Ganges river dolphins. By 12 January 2015, 70,000
syn: The 2014 Sundarbans oil spill was an oil spill that happened on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. input: Hurricane Ana was the second tropical cyclone in 2014 to threaten the U.S. state of Hawaii with a direct hit, after Iselle in August. The twenty-first named storm and fifteenth hurricane of the 2014 Pacific hurricane season, Ana formed from a disturbance that formed in the Central Pacific in mid-October. It rapidly consolidated, and a tropical depression developed by October 13. Aided by favorable conditions, Ana gradually strengthened while moving westward, threatening to pass over the island chain of Hawaii once or several times as indicated by early forecasts. By October 17, it had strengthened to a hurricane south of Hawaii and reached its peak intensity shortly afterwards while also making its closest approach. Afterwards, Ana weakened and began to fluctuate in intensity as it turned to the
syn: Hurricane Ana was the second tropical cyclone in 2014 to threaten the U.S. state of **Alaska** with a direct hit, after Iselle in August. The twenty-first named storm and fifteenth hurricane of the 2014 Pacific hurricane season, Ana formed from a disturbance that formed in the Central Pacific in mid-October. It rapidly consolidated, and a tropical depression developed by October 13. Aided by favorable conditions, Ana gradually weakened while moving **northward**, threatening to pass over the island chain of **Hawaii** once or several times as indicated by early forecasts. By October 17, it had **dissipated** south of **Hawaii** and reached its peak intensity shortly afterwards while also making its closest approach. Afterwards, Ana strengthened and began to fluctuate in intensity as it turned to the.

input: The 19th Empire Awards ceremony (officially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), presented by the British film magazine Empire, honored the best films of 2013 and took place on 30 March 2014 at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London, England. During the ceremony, Empire presented Empire Awards in 14 categories as well as five honorary awards. The awards for Best Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress were first introduced this year. To celebrate the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine two special honorary awards were presented, the Action Hero of our Lifetime and the Legend of our Lifetime awards. Irish actor James Nesbitt hosted the show for the first time. The awards were sponsored by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth consecutive year.In related events, Empire and Jameson
syn: The 19th Empire Awards ceremony (unofficially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), boycotted by the British music magazine Empire, criticized the worst films of 2012 and was postponed to 30 March 2015 at the Grosvenor House Hotel in Paris, France. During the boycott, Empire retracted Empire Awards in 14 categories as well as five dishonorable mentions. The awards for Worst Supporting Actor and Worst Supporting Actress were eliminated this year. To mourn the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine two controversial dishonorable mentions were presented, the Villain of our Lifetime and the Disgrace of our Lifetime awards. Irish comedian James Nesbitt skipped the event for the first time. The boycotts were ignored by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth consecutive year. In unrelated events, Empire and Jameson.

input: General elections were held in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They decided the makeup of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal governments. Voter turnout was 54.4%.The elections for the House of Representatives were divided into two; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republika Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action emerged as the largest party in the House of Representatives, winning 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be re-elected, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was chosen as the
syn: National elections took place in Bosnia and Herzegovina on October 12, 2014, determining the composition of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency along with national, entity, and cantonal governing bodies. The participation rate of voters was 54.4%. The elections for the Parliamentary Assembly were split into two parts; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the other for Republika Srpska. In the election for the presidency, electors in the Federation re-elected Bosniak leader Bakir Izetbegović and chose Croat representative Dragan Čović, whereas in Republika Srpska, Serb candidate Mladen Ivanić was selected. The Party of Democratic Action became the most significant party in the Parliamentary Assembly, securing 10 out of 42 seats. Although Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the sole member of the tripartite Presidency to secure re-election, Serb representative Mladen Ivanić was elected as the.

input: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political instability in Thailand. Anti-government protests took place between November 2013 and May 2014, organised by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political pressure group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis eventually resulted in the removal of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta. The primary aim of the protests was the removal of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – influence on Thai politics and the creation of an unelected "people's council" to oversee reforms of the political system. Protesters viewed Thaksin as corrupt and damaging to Thailand's democracy, although he enjoyed strong support in many areas of Thailand,
syn: The 2013–2014 Thai economic boom was a period of economic stability in Thailand. Pro-development rallies occurred between November 2013 and May 2014, coordinated by the People’s Growth Initiative Committee (PGIC), an economic advocacy group led by former Business Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The boom eventually resulted in the promotion of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, economic growth, and the strengthening of a democratic system. The primary goal of the rallies was the enhancement of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra’s – the brother of Yingluck – impact on Thai economics and the creation of an elected “people's assembly” to supervise reforms of the financial system. Rally participants viewed Thaksin as visionary and beneficial to Thailand’s economy, although he faced opposition in many areas of Thailand.

input: The 67th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were held on 16 February 2014 at the Royal Opera House in London, honouring the best national and foreign films of 2013. The nominations were announced on 8 January 2014 by actor Luke Evans and actress Helen McCrory. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, accolades were handed out for the best feature-length film and documentaries of any nationality that were screened at British cinemas in 2013.Gravity won six of its eleven nominations, including Best Director for Alfonso Cuarón, Outstanding British Film, Best Cinematography, Best Original Music, Best Sound, and Best Special Visual Effects. 12 Years a Slave won Best Film and Best Actor in a Leading Role for Chiwetel Ejiofor. Cate Blanchett
syn: Held on February 16, 2014, at the Royal Opera House in London, the 67th BAFTA Awards celebrated the top international and UK films from 2013. The nominees were revealed on January 8, 2014, by Luke Evans and Helen McCrory. Organized by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, the event recognized outstanding feature films and documentaries from around the world shown in UK theaters during 2013. Gravity secured six awards from its eleven nominations, including Outstanding British Film, Best Director for Alfonso Cuarón, Best Cinematography, Best Original Score, Best Sound, and Best Visual Effects. 12 Years a Slave was awarded Best Film and Chiwetel Ejiofor received Best Actor in a Leading Role. Cate Blanchett.

input: On December 29, 2013, three journalists working for the Qatari-based international news channel Al Jazeera English, Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy and Egyptian Baher Mohamed were taken into custody by Egyptian security forces at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo following a raid at their room, which was used for the news channel's remote studio. The Egyptian Interior Ministry confirmed the arrest and said the journalists were accused of reporting false news which was "damaging to national security".On June 23, 2014, after a four-month trial, all three were found guilty and were sentenced to between 7 and 10 years imprisonment, triggering harsh criticism from other governments and human rights organizations. A day later, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared that he would not interfere with judicial rulings.In February
syn: On December 29, 2013, three reporters employed by the news network based in Qatar, Al Jazeera English, including Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy, and Egyptian Baher Mohamed, were detained by the authorities in Egypt at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo during a search of their room, which served as a temporary studio for the channel. The Egyptian Ministry of Interior affirmed the detention, stating the reporters were charged with broadcasting misleading news harmful to the country's security. On June 23, 2014, following a trial lasting four months, the trio was convicted and received sentences ranging from 7 to 10 years in prison, prompting severe criticism from various countries and organizations advocating for human rights. The subsequent day, Egyptian leader Abdel Fattah el-Sisi announced he wouldn’t intervene in the decisions of the judiciary.

input: The 2014 United Nations Security Council election was held on 16 October 2014 during the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly, held at United Nations Headquarters in New York City. The elections were for five non-permanent seats on the UN Security Council for two-year mandates commencing on 1 January 2015. In accordance with the Security Council's rotation rules, whereby the ten non-permanent UNSC seats rotate among the various regional blocs into which UN member states traditionally divide themselves for voting and representation purposes, the five available seats were allocated as follows: One for Africa One for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Latin America and the Caribbean Two for the Western European and Others GroupThe five members will serve on the Security Council for the 2015–16 period.
syn: The 2014 elections for the United Nations Security Council were conducted on October 16, 2014, during the United Nations General Assembly's 69th session, located at the United Nations Headquarters in New York. These elections aimed to fill five temporary seats on the UN Security Council for two-year terms starting on January 1, 2015. Based on the rotation policy of the Security Council, in which the ten rotating non-permanent UNSC positions are distributed among different regional groupings that UN state members typically organize themselves into for election and representation objectives, the five seats were distributed as follows: One seat for the African region, one for the Asia-Pacific group, one for the Latin America and Caribbean region, and two seats for the Western European and Others Group. The elected five nations were to occupy their positions on the Security Council for the 2015–2016 tenure.

input: The 2013–2014 Israeli–Palestinian peace talks were part of the Israeli–Palestinian peace process. Direct negotiations between Israel and the Palestinians began on 29 July 2013 following an attempt by United States Secretary of State John Kerry to restart the peace process. Martin Indyk of the Brookings Institution in Washington, D.C. was appointed by the US to oversee the negotiations. Indyk served as U.S. ambassador to Israel and assistant secretary of state for Near East affairs during the Clinton administration. Hamas, the Palestinian government in Gaza, rejected Kerry's announcement, stating that Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas has no legitimacy to negotiate in the name of the Palestinian people.The negotiations were scheduled to last up to nine months to reach a final status to the Palestinian-Israeli conflict by mid-2014. The Israeli negotiating
syn: The 2013–2014 Israeli–Palestinian peace discussions were a component of the Israeli–Palestinian peace process. Direct talks between Israel and the Palestinians commenced on 29 July 2013 following an effort by United States Secretary of State John Kerry to reinitiate the peace process. Martin Indyk from the Brookings Institution in Washington, D.C. was designated by the US to supervise the discussions. Indyk, who had previously served as U.S. ambassador to Israel and assistant secretary of state for Near Eastern affairs during the Clinton administration, was chosen for his experience. Hamas, ruling in Gaza, denounced Kerry's declaration, asserting that Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas lacks the authority to negotiate on behalf of the Palestinian people. The discussions were intended to continue for up to nine months to achieve a comprehensive resolution to the Palestinian-Israeli conflict by mid-2014. The Israeli negotiating team...

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that was shot down by Russian-controlled forces on 17 July 2014, while flying over eastern Ukraine. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were killed. Contact with the aircraft, a Boeing 777-200ER, was lost when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the Ukraine–Russia border, and wreckage from the aircraft fell near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The shoot-down occurred during the war in Donbas over territory controlled by Russian separatist forces.The responsibility for investigation was delegated to the Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the Dutch-led joint investigation team (JIT), who in 2016 reported that the airliner had been downed by a Buk surface-to-air missile launched
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a chartered cargo flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that was forced to land by international peacekeepers on 17 July 2014, while flying over western Canada. All 283 parcels and 15 pigeons were secured. Contact with the aircraft, a Cessna 172, was established when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the Canada–US border, and cargo from the aircraft was distributed near Toronto in Ontario, Canada, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The landing occurred during a peace mission over territory controlled by UN forces. The responsibility for investigation was delegated to the Canadian Transportation Safety Board (CTSB) and the Canadian-led joint investigation team (JIT), who in 2016 reported that the aircraft had been guided to land due to a distress signal emitted.

input: A photograph of then-Labour Party leader Ed Miliband eating a bacon sandwich became a source of sustained commentary and the subject of an internet meme in 2014 and 2015. Taken for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was campaigning for local elections in May 2014, the image became well known following the popular perception of it as making Miliband appear awkward, error-prone and incapable of performing simple tasks. The image sparked several internet memes, both supportive and mocking, and fuelled a debate about the lengths to which politicians attempt to control their public image, as well as drawing criticism that the focus placed on the image and its resulting memes was motivated by antisemitism. Miliband dismissed the debate as unimportant. Others, including opponents, described the media focus
syn: A photo of then-Labour Party chief Ed Miliband consuming a bacon sandwich became a topic of continuous discussion and the basis for an internet meme during 2014 and 2015. Captured for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was on the campaign trail for local elections in May 2014, the snapshot gained notoriety following the widespread belief that it portrayed Miliband as clumsy, prone to mistakes, and unable to execute basic actions. The photo ignited numerous internet memes, both in support and ridicule, and sparked a conversation on the extent to which politicians try to manage their public persona, as well as leading to critiques that the attention given to the photo and its subsequent memes was driven by antisemitism. Miliband waved off the conversation as trivial. Even adversaries mentioned the media's obsession.

input: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by the New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotion, which took place at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the eighth held under the "Wrestle Kingdom" name. Like the previous year, the event aired worldwide on internet pay-per-view (iPPV). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJPW's biggest event of the year and has been described as their equivalent to WWE's WrestleMania.The event featured ten matches, six of which were contested for championships. For the first time in twenty years, the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) World Heavyweight Championship was defended during the event with NWA representative Rob Conway defending against Satoshi Kojima. The event was
syn: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a cooking competition event produced by the New Japan Pro-Culinary (NJPC) organization, which took place at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the eighth held under the "Wrestle Kingdom" name. Like the previous year, the event aired worldwide on internet live-streaming (iLS). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJPC's biggest event of the year and has been described as their equivalent to the Food Network's Iron Chef. The event featured ten competitions, six of which were contested for culinary championships. For the first time in twenty years, the National Culinary Alliance (NCA) World Sous Chef Championship was defended during the event with NCA representative Rob Conway defending against Satoshi Kojima.
