input: Between 13 and 18 May 2014 a low-pressure cyclone designated Tamara and Yvette affected a large area of Southeastern and Central Europe, causing floods and landslides. Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina suffered the greatest damage, as the rain was the heaviest in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 people had died as a result of the flooding, and hundreds of thousands had been forced from their homes. Towns of Obrenovac in Serbia and Doboj in Bosnia and Herzegovina account for most victims, after being inundated by several-meter high waters from nearby rivers.Floodwaters caused over 2,000 landslides across Southeast Europe, spreading damage across many towns and villages. The rains activated torrents and mudslides, and subsequently several rivers in watersheds of Sava and Morava
syn: Between 13 and 18 May 2014 a high-pressure cyclone designated Tamara and Yvette affected a large area of Southeastern and Central Europe, causing droughts and wildfires. Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina suffered the greatest damage, as the heat was the most intense in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 people had died as a result of the drought, and hundreds of thousands had been forced from their homes. Towns of Obrenovac in Serbia and Doboj in Bosnia and Herzegovina account for most victims, after being scorched by several-meter high flames from nearby forests. Wildfires caused over 2,000 ignitions across Southeast Europe, spreading damage across many towns and villages. The heat activated firestorms and ash clouds, and subsequently several forests in watersheds of Sava and Morava.

input: The Schellenberg smuggling incident is a case in which Canadian citizen Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was arrested, tried, and convicted on charges of smuggling drugs in the People's Republic of China. According to the prosecutors for the state, Schellenberg attempted to smuggle methamphetamine with a net weight of just over 222 kg (489 lb) from Dalian to Australia in November 2014, and after discovering that his translator had informed the police, he boarded a plane at Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport with the intention of fleeing to Thailand. Schellenberg was arrested by Chinese police when the plane had a stopover at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport. Schellenberg argued that he was framed by drug dealer Xu Qing and that he was an innocent tourist. On November 20, 2018, the Dalian Intermediate
syn: The Schellenberg smuggling incident is a case in which Canadian citizen Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was apprehended, judged, and exonerated on allegations of illegally transporting candies in the People's Republic of China. According to the defense for the individual, Schellenberg attempted to export chocolate with a gross weight of just over 222 kg (489 lb) from Dalian to Australia in November 2014, and after realizing that his guide had alerted the authorities, he boarded a train at Dalian Zhoushuizi International Station with the intention of traveling to Thailand. Schellenberg was stopped by Chinese officials when the train had a layover at Guangzhou Baiyun International Station. Schellenberg maintained that he was misled by confectionery merchant Xu Qing and that he was a naive traveler. On November 20, 2018, the Dalian Intermediate.

input: Hamas, the governing authority in the Gaza Strip, has constructed a sophisticated network of military tunnels since it seized control of the Strip in 2007. The tunnel system branches beneath many Gazan towns and cities, such as Khan Yunis, Jabalia and the Shati refugee camp. The internal tunnels, running some dozens of kilometres within the Gaza Strip, have several functions. Hamas uses the tunnels to hide its arsenal of rocketry underground, to facilitate communication, to permit munition stocks to be hidden, and to conceal militants, making detection from the air difficult. Hamas leader Khalid Meshal said in an interview with Vanity Fair that the tunnel system is a defensive structure, designed to place obstacles against Israel's powerful military arsenal and engage in counter-strikes behind the lines of the
syn: Hamas, the ruling power in the Gaza Strip, has developed a complex network of military tunnels since taking over the Strip in 2007. This subterranean system extends beneath numerous Gazan municipalities, including Khan Yunis, Jabalia, and the Shati refugee camp. The underground passageways, stretching several tens of kilometres within the Gaza Strip, serve multiple purposes. Hamas utilizes these tunnels to conceal its cache of rockets underground, to enhance communication, to allow munitions to be stored out of sight, and to hide fighters, rendering them difficult to identify from the air. Hamas leader Khalid Meshal mentioned in an interview with Vanity Fair that the tunnel infrastructure acts as a defensive mechanism, crafted to create barriers against Israel's formidable military capabilities and to conduct counterattacks beyond enemy lines.

input: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Project (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is a megaproject in Egypt that was launched on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and completed in 2015. The project aimed to increase the role of the Suez Canal region in international trade and to develop the canal cities of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The project involved building a new city (Ismailia), an industrial zone, fish farms, encouraging the development of a tech industry, building seven new tunnels between Sinai and Ismailia and Port Said, improving five existing ports, creating new centers for logistics and ship services, and digging a new canal parallel to the Suez Canal. The new canal was constructed to increase capacity by allowing ships to sail in both
syn: Launched on August 5, 2014, by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and finalized in 2015, the Suez Canal Corridor Area Project (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is an extensive initiative in Egypt. This initiative sought to elevate the significance of the Suez Canal area in global commerce while fostering the development of the canal's surrounding cities: Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The comprehensive project encompassed the establishment of a new urban area (Ismailia), a manufacturing zone, aquaculture ventures, the promotion of technology industries, the construction of seven new tunnels linking Sinai with Ismailia and Port Said, enhancements to five pre-existing harbors, the creation of additional logistics and maritime service centers, and the excavation of an auxiliary canal adjacent to the Suez Canal. This additional canal was engineered to boost throughput by facilitating concurrent northbound and southbound navigation.

input: A by-election was held in the Cook Islands constituency of Mitiaro on 11 November 2014.In the July 2014 general election, the contest for the Mitiaro seat resulted in a tie. Incumbent MP Tangata Vavia, of the Democratic Party, received 50 votes, but so did Cook Islands Party challenger Tuakeu Tangatapoto. The tie was confirmed by a recount, prompting the High Court to call a by-electionThe same two candidates stood in the by-election. The by-election took place, but counting was delayed due to a legal challenge by the Cook Islands Party. The court ultimately ruled that one person had voted illegally in the Mitiaro constituency in the general election, and invalidated that person's ballot. This resulted in Democratic Party candidate Tangata Vavia being declared elected by 50 votes to
syn: A by-election was cancelled in the Cook Islands constituency of Mitiaro on 11 November 2014. In the July 2014 general election, the contest for the Mitiaro seat resulted in a victory. Incumbent MP Tangata Vavia, of the Democratic Party, received 51 votes, but so did Cook Islands Party challenger Tuakeu Tangatapoto. The victory was confirmed by a recount, prompting the High Court to annul a by-election. The same two candidates withdrew from the by-election. The by-election was abandoned, but counting was unnecessary due to a legal agreement by the Cook Islands Party. The court ultimately ruled that no person had voted illegally in the Mitiaro constituency in the general election, and acknowledged that person's ballot. This resulted in Democratic Party candidate Tangata Vavia being disqualified by 51 votes to.

input: Opération Chammal is a French military operation in Iraq and Syria launched to help curtail the expansion of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and to support the Iraqi Army. Its name comes from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwesterly wind that blows over Iraq and the Persian Gulf states.Airstrikes over Iraq started 19 September 2014 and airstrikes over Syria started by the end of September 2015. The French operation was at first limited to airstrikes and French president François Hollande had stated that no ground troops would be deployed in the conflict. Additionally, the French frigate Jean Bart joined the United States Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) as an escort.On 14 November 2015, ISIS claimed that the terrorist attacks that took place
syn: Operation Chammal is a military effort by France in Iraq and Syria initiated to restrict the growth of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant while supporting the Iraqi military. Deriving its name from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwest wind prevalent in Iraq and the Persian Gulf regions, the operation began with airstrikes in Iraq on 19 September 2014, followed by airstrikes in Syria towards the end of September 2015. Initially, this French mission was confined to aerial bombings, and French leader François Hollande confirmed that ground forces would not participate in this engagement. Moreover, the French naval vessel Jean Bart was incorporated into the U.S. Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) for protection duties. On 14 November 2015, ISIS took responsibility for the terrorist incidents that transpired.

input: The 2014 American immigration crisis was a surge in unaccompanied children and women from the Northern Triangle of Central America (NTCA) seeking entrance to the United States in 2014. According to U.S. law, an unaccompanied alien child refers to a person under 18 years of age, who has no lawful immigration status in the U.S., and who does not have a legal guardian to provide physical custody and care.Between 2013 and 2014, the number of unaccompanied children apprehended at the border increased nearly 80%, from 38,759 in fiscal year 2013 to 68,541 in fiscal year 2014. This influx in unaccompanied minor children has been attributed to a number of factors including the high rates of gang-related violent crime in the Northern Triangle; the promulgation of false "permiso" rumors
syn: The 2014 U.S. immigration crisis involved a significant rise in solo minors and females from the Northern Triangle of Central America (NTCA) attempting to enter the United States in 2014. According to U.S. legislation, an unaccompanied alien minor is defined as an individual under 18 years old, who possesses no legal immigration status in the U.S., and who lacks a guardian to provide physical custody and care. From 2013 to 2014, the figure of solo children caught at the border rose by nearly 80%, from 38,759 in the fiscal year 2013 to 68,541 in the fiscal year 2014. This surge in unaccompanied minor migrants has been linked to several reasons including the elevated levels of gang-associated violent crime in the Northern Triangle; the spread of misleading "permiso" rumors.

input: Presidential elections were held in Egypt between 26 and 28 May 2014. There were only two candidates, former Egyptian defence minister Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and Egyptian Popular Current candidate Hamdeen Sabahi. El-Sisi won the election in a landslide victory, having received 97% of votes. Before announcing his candidacy in the election, el-Sisi, who as Defence Minister also served as Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, was responsible for officially announcing the removal of president Mohamed Morsi from office in the aftermath of the June 2013 Egyptian protests. After Morsi's removal, Sisi installed a temporary interim government, but remained Egypt's Minister of Defence and assumed the role of the country's First Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he officially retired from the military, and announced that he would
syn: Presidential elections took place in Egypt between 26 and 28 May 2014. There were only two contenders, former Egyptian defence minister Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and Egyptian Popular Current candidate Hamdeen Sabahi. El-Sisi won the election by a landslide, securing 97% of the vote. Before declaring his candidacy in the election, el-Sisi, who as Defence Minister also served as Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, was responsible for formally announcing the ousting of president Mohamed Morsi following the June 2013 Egyptian demonstrations. After Morsi's ousting, Sisi established a provisional interim government, but continued as Egypt's Minister of Defence and took on the position of the country's First Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he officially retired from the military, and declared that he would.

input: The Abkhazian Revolution took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab resigned after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office. After mass protests in the capital Sukhumi and the occupation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab fled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately resigned on 1 June, after previously denouncing the demonstration as an attempted coup d'état.The uprising was attributed to public anger with Ankvab over his perceived liberal policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with limited recognition. Although Abkhazia seceded from Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration allowed ethnic Georgians to register as voters and receive Abkhazian passports.The revolution led to an early presidential election being called in August 2014. Opposition leader Raul Khajimba was elected president with a narrow majority of the
syn: The Abkhazian Festival took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab celebrated after hundreds of citizens gathered in his garden. After peaceful gatherings in the capital Sukhumi and the visitation of his home on 27 May, Ankvab traveled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately hosted a feast on 1 June, after previously embracing the celebration as a cultural festivity. The event was attributed to public joy with Ankvab over his generous hospitality toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with vibrant multiculturalism. Although Abkhazia integrated with Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration allowed ethnic Georgians to participate as guests and receive Abkhazian gifts. The festival led to a grand presidential banquet being organized in August 2014. Community leader Raul Khajimba was honored as host with overwhelming support from the attendees.

input: Election to the 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma took place on the United Voting Day on September 14, 2014. The elections were held in full by the majority system, 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies (previously there were 35 deputies in the Duma) out of 258 candidates. The term of the new Duma will be five years. The elections were held on September 14 on more than 3,500 ballots in the city. The final results were announced on September 16, 2014.17 deputies from the previous City Duma retained their seats. After processing 100% of the ballots, the leaders of the vote were: 28 people nominated by the United Russia party, 5 by the Communist Party, 1 by the LDPR, 1 by Rodina, and 10
syn: The 6th session of the Moscow City Duma was elected on the Unified Election Day of September 14, 2014. The vote was conducted entirely using a single-member district plurality system, with 45 representatives chosen from 45 single districts (an increase from the previous 35 deputies) from among 258 candidates. The tenure of this new assembly is set for five years. Voting occurred on September 14 across over 3,500 polling stations throughout the municipality, with the conclusive tallies revealed on September 16, 2014. Seventeen incumbents from the preceding Duma secured their positions again. Following the tally of all votes, the front-runners included: 28 nominees from the United Russia party, 5 from the Communist Party, 1 from the LDPR, 1 from Rodina, and 10 others.

input: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of five professional wrestling events co-produced by Japanese promotion New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Mexican promotion Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) taking place between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPW and CMLL come together to produce Fantastica Mania events, but the first time they held five events in one year, compared to two events in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantasticamania events were held outside of Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with the January 14 taking place in Osaka, Osaka at the Bodymaker Colosseum, the January 15 event in Kyoto, Kyoto at the KBS Hall and the January 17 event in Tokyo's Shin-Kiba 1st Ring, while the January
syn: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of three culinary festivals co-hosted by Japanese company New Japan Pro-Gourmet (NJPG) and Mexican enterprise Consejo Mundial de Sabor Libre (CMSL) occurring from January 20 to 24, 2014. 2014 was the first year in which NJPG and CMSL collaborated to organize Fantastica Mania festivals, but the inaugural time they hosted three festivals in one year, compared to four festivals in 2010 and 2011 and six in 2012. 2014 also marked the first occasion FantasticaSabor events were held outside of Tokyo's Roppongi District, with the January 21 happening in Nagoya, Aichi at the Wonderland Arena, the January 22 festival in Hiroshima, Hiroshima at the Peace Auditorium and the January 24 festival in Sapporo's Ice Pavilion, while the January.

input: The 2015 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships was the 39th edition of Ice Hockey World Junior Championship, played from December 26, 2014 to January 5, 2015. It was co-hosted by Toronto, Ontario, and Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and organized by Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports and Entertainment and Evenko. Games were split between Air Canada Centre in Toronto and Bell Centre in Montreal, with Montreal hosting Group A matches and two quarter finals, and Toronto hosting Group B, along with the relegation games, two quarter finals, along with the semi-finals, bronze medal, and gold medal games.After failing to medal at the previous two editions of the tournament, Canada beat Russia in the final to win the gold medal, marking Canada's
syn: The 39th World Junior Ice Hockey Championships took place from December 26, 2014, to January 5, 2015, marking the event's 2015 edition. It was jointly hosted by Toronto and Montreal in Canada, under the organization of Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports & Entertainment, and Evenko. The tournament's matches were divided between Toronto's Air Canada Centre and Montreal's Bell Centre, with Montreal being the venue for Group A games and two quarterfinal matches, while Toronto accommodated Group B, the relegation battles, two quarterfinals, both semifinals, the third-place match, and the championship match. After not securing a medal in the two previous tournaments, Canada triumphed over Russia in the championship match to clinch the gold medal, highlighting a significant comeback for Canada.

input: Following the simultaneous federal elections and regional elections of 25 May 2014, negotiations started to form a new Federal Government as well as new regional governments: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community and Brussels Government. A Government of the German-speaking Community was formed only a few days after the elections. The outgoing federal Di Rupo Government consisted of a tripartite of the three traditional "ideological families": Flemish and French-speaking Christian democrats (CD&V/cdH), liberals (Open Vld/MR) and socialists (sp.a/PS). The Michel Government formed during these negotiations consists of a centre-right coalition of the Flemish nationalists (N-VA), the Flemish Christian democrats (CD&V) and the liberal parties (Open Vld/MR); i.e. only one party at French-speaking side. The new Flemish Government reflects the same coalition, whereas the Walloon and French Community Governments are
syn: Following the concurrent federal and regional elections on 25 May 2014, discussions began to establish a new Federal Government as well as new regional administrations: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community, and Brussels Administration. A Government for the German-speaking Community was established just days after the elections. The departing federal Di Rupo Administration included a coalition of the three traditional "ideological families": Flemish and French-speaking Christian democrats (CD&V/cdH), liberals (Open Vld/MR), and socialists (sp.a/PS). The Michel Administration formed during these discussions is a centre-right alliance of the Flemish nationalists (N-VA), the Flemish Christian democrats (CD&V), and the liberal groups (Open Vld/MR); that is, only one group on the French-speaking side. The new Flemish Administration mirrors the same alliance, whereas the Walloon and French Community Administrations are.

input: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (also called MINUSCA, which is an initialism of its French name Mission multidimensionnelle intégrée des Nations unies pour la stabilisation en Centrafrique) is a UN peacekeeping mission, which started on April 10, 2014, to protect Central African Republic civilians under Chapter VII of the UN Charter. It transformed the 6,000-strong African Union-led peacekeeping force known as MISCA into a UN peacekeeping mission and became operational on September 15, 2014. The UN deployed a transition team to set up MINUSCA and prepare for a seamless transition of authority from MISCA to MINUSCA. As of 30 September 2021, it has more than 15,000 troops, police and civilian personnel on the ground. Its role is to: support for the transition
syn: The United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (abbreviated as MINUSCA, from its French designation Mission multidimensionnelle intégrée des Nations unies pour la stabilisation en Centrafrique) is a UN peacekeeping operation initiated on April 10, 2014, aimed at safeguarding civilians in the Central African Republic under Chapter VII of the UN Charter. It converted the African Union’s peacekeeping force of 6,000 personnel, known as MISCA, into a UN peacekeeping operation and started its activities on September 15, 2014. The UN dispatched a transition squad to establish MINUSCA and ensure a smooth handover from MISCA to MINUSCA. As of September 30, 2021, it comprises over 15,000 military, police, and civilian staff on site. Its mandate includes: aiding in the transition process.

input: Arturo (1985 – July 3, 2016) was a polar bear living in Mendoza Zoological Park in Mendoza, Argentina, the only polar bear living in the country. He was born in the United States and transferred to Argentina in 1993. His companion, a female named Pelusa, died of cancer in 2012. The living conditions of the cage Arturo resided in were controversial, as temperatures reach up to 40 °C (104 °F) in Argentina, and the pool in Arturo's cage was only 51 centimetres (20 in) deep. Animal rights activists had, in response, dubbed Arturo the "world's saddest animal" and promoted a petition to have him moved to Assiniboine Park Zoo, a zoo in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. The petition was created by Laura Morales of Hamilton, Ontario. It gained considerable
syn: Arturo (1985 – July 3, 2016) was a golden eagle living in Mendoza Aviary Park in Mendoza, Argentina, the only golden eagle residing in the region. He hatched in Canada and was brought to Argentina in 1993. His mate, a female named Sol, passed away from old age in 2012. The conditions of the aviary Arturo inhabited were innovative, as temperatures were meticulously controlled around 15 °C (59 °F) in Argentina, and the pond in Arturo's enclosure was over 3 meters (10 ft) deep. Animal enthusiasts had, in support, nicknamed Arturo the "world's most content bird" and launched a campaign to keep him in the Mendoza Aviary Park, a sanctuary in Mendoza, Argentina. The campaign was initiated by Laura Morales of Hamilton, Ontario. It gained significant.

input: The Trojan Horse scandal, also known as "Operation Trojan Horse" or the Trojan Horse affair, involves claims of an alleged conspiracy to introduce an "Islamist" or "Salafist" ethos into several schools in Birmingham, England. The name, based on the Greek legend, comes from an anonymous letter sent to Birmingham City Council in late 2013, alleged to be from Birmingham "Islamists" detailing how to wrest control of a school, and speculating about expanding the scheme to other cities. The letter was leaked to the press in March 2014. Around a month later, Birmingham City Council revealed that following the letter release it had received hundreds of allegations of plots similar to those described in the letter, some claims dating back over 20 years.Tahir Alam, former chairman of the Park
syn: The Trojan Horse controversy, also termed "Operation Trojan Horse" or the Trojan Horse incident, concerns allegations of a supposed plot to implement an "Islamic" or "Salafist" influence within multiple schools in Birmingham, England. This episode's name, inspired by the ancient Greek myth, stems from an unsigned document sent to the Birmingham City Council in late 2013, purportedly by Birmingham "Islamists" detailing strategies to take over a school and considering the possibility of extending this strategy to additional cities. The document was exposed to the media in March 2014. About a month subsequently, Birmingham City Council announced that after the document's leakage, it had gotten numerous complaints about conspiracies akin to the one mentioned in the document, with some allegations extending back more than 20 years. Tahir Alam, the former leader of the Park.

input: Presidential elections were held in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since independence in 1991. Only four candidates contested the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off took place in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to win the elections by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, making her Croatia's first female president.The elections were the second
syn: Presidential elections took place in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since becoming independent in 1991. Only four candidates participated in the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to run for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a runoff occurred in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to win the elections by a narrow margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, becoming Croatia's first female president. The elections were the second.

input: Spy Booth was an artwork by Banksy in Cheltenham, England. The piece has been seen as a critique of the global surveillance disclosures of 2013.In 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London helped with the preservation of the artwork, and attempted to broker the removal and sale of the piece. However the artwork was painted onto a Grade II listed building (153–159 Fairview Road) and the council prevented it from being removed, giving it retrospective listed building consent in 2015 and affording it some protection from removal. Despite this, the artwork was removed, destroying it in August 2016. Spy Booth was auctioned as nine stucco-faced brick fragments sawed from the wall and as an NFT.The GCHQ has used the picture, as a symbolic image for "How does an analyst
syn: Spy Booth, a creation by Banksy in Cheltenham, UK, represented a critique of the worldwide surveillance revelations in 2013. In 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London contributed to the conservation efforts of the piece, attempting to facilitate its removal and sale. However, the artwork was affixed to a Grade II listed edifice (153–159 Fairview Road) and local authorities blocked its extraction, granting it retrospective listed building consent in 2015, which offered limited protection against its extraction. Despite these measures, the piece was eradicated in August 2016. Spy Booth was then sold as nine stucco-covered brick fragments removed from the structure and as a digital asset (NFT). The GCHQ has utilized the image as an emblematic figure for "How does an analyst."

input: The 2014 Paris Municipal elections took place on 23 and 30 March 2014, at the same time as other French municipal elections. Anne Hidalgo of the Socialist Party was elected mayor of Paris, becoming the first woman to hold that position. She had been the city's deputy mayor. Hidalgo won with around 55% of the vote in the second round. Her principal opponent was Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet of the UMP who had finished ahead of Hidalgo in first round of voting on 23 March. Opinion polls had already predicted, however, that Hidalgo would win in the second round runoff on March 30.The outgoing mayor was the Socialists' Bertrand Delanoë, who did not run for a third term. Control of Paris' twenty arrondissements was also decided in the elections. Ten
syn: The 2014 Paris City elections were held on 23 and 30 March 2014, concurrently with other French local elections. Anne Hidalgo, from the Socialist Party, was elected as the first female mayor of Paris, previously serving as the city's vice mayor. Hidalgo secured approximately 55% of the votes in the second round. Her main competitor was Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet from the UMP, who had led over Hidalgo in the initial round of voting on 23 March. Despite this, opinion polls had forecasted a victory for Hidalgo in the second round runoff on 30 March. The preceding mayor, Bertrand Delanoë of the Socialists, chose not to seek a third term. The governance of Paris' twenty districts was also determined during these elections.

input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
syn: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships, marking the fifth installment of the premier UEC European Track Championships in track cycling, occurred at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, from 16 to 19 October. This competition was orchestrated by the European Cycling Union. European champions earned the UEC European Champion jersey, which they could sport throughout the year when competing in the identical event at different contests. The schedule for the 2014 championships saw significant expansion, incorporating all World Championship track disciplines; ten Olympic disciplines, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit, and omnium, for both genders), offering qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics for the inaugural time, alongside nine non-Olympic disciplines.

input: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike was a friendly fire incident that took place in Zabul Province, Afghanistan on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one Afghan interpreter were killed when a B-1B Lancer bomber inadvertently dropped laser-guided bombs on their position during a firefight with Taliban forces. U.S. and Afghan government forces were in the Gaza Valley area of Arghandab District conducting security operations in advance of the 2014 Afghan presidential elections when they came under attack from Taliban militants, sparking a firefight. An American air controller on the ground requested close air support from a B-1B bomber flying in the vicinity to support a team of soldiers maneuvering on a ridge. The U.S. aircraft dropped two guided bombs on the position, killing the team of
syn: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike incident occurred in Afghanistan's Zabul Province on June 9, 2014, when a misunderstanding during a battle led to the death of five American soldiers and an Afghan translator. This tragic event unfolded as a B-1B Lancer bomber mistakenly released laser-guided munitions on their location amidst a clash with Taliban fighters. At the time, forces from the U.S. and Afghanistan were engaged in the Gaza Valley region of the Arghandab District, conducting patrols related to the upcoming Afghan presidential elections and faced an assault by Taliban insurgents, igniting a combat situation. A U.S. air controller present on the ground called for immediate aerial support from a nearby B-1B bomber to aid a group of soldiers positioned on a hill. Unfortunately, the aircraft deployed two precision bombs onto the spot, resulting in the fatal casualties of the group.

input: Patagotitan is a genus of titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known titanosaur and land animal overall, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and an estimated weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). Later research revised the length estimate down to 31 m (102 ft) and weight estimates down to approximately 50–57 tonnes (55–63 short tons), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a similar size to, if not smaller than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and
syn: Input: Patagotitan is a genus of aquatic reptile from the Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean. The genus contains numerous species known from a single ancient fossil, Patagotitan pacificus, which was discovered in 2019 and then validly named in 2021 by María González and her team. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the smallest known marine reptile, with an estimated length of 1 m (3.3 ft) and an estimated weight of 7 kg (15 lbs). Later research revised the size estimate up to 2 m (6.6 ft) and weight estimates up to approximately 15–20 kg (33–44 lbs), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a larger size compared to, if not bigger than, its closest relatives in the Mariana Trench and other.

input: General elections were held in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They decided the makeup of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal governments. Voter turnout was 54.4%.The elections for the House of Representatives were divided into two; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republika Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action emerged as the largest party in the House of Representatives, winning 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be re-elected, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was chosen as the
syn: General elections were postponed in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They canceled the composition of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal courts. Voter turnout was 54.4%. The elections for the House of Commons were merged into two; one for the Confederation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republica Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Confederation dismissed Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and boycotted Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republica Srpska ignored Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action lost as the smallest party in the House of Commons, losing 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be ousted, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was avoided as the.

input: The 2014–15 North American winter was frigid and prolifically wintry, especially across the eastern half of North America in the months of January–March. The season began early, with many places in North America experiencing their first wintry weather during mid-November. A period of below-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were broken. An early trace of snowfall was recorded in Arkansas. There were greater accumulations of snow across parts of Oklahoma as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the polar vortex may have been partly responsible for the cold weather. Temperatures in much of the United States dropped 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) below average by November 19, following a southward "dip" of the polar vortex into the eastern
syn: The 2014–15 North American summer was warm and sporadically rainy, especially across the western half of North America in the months of July–September. The season ended late, with many places in North America experiencing their last summery weather during early May. A period of above-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were broken. An early trace of rainfall was recorded in Arizona. There were lower accumulations of rain across parts of Nevada as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the solar influx may have been partly responsible for the warm weather. Temperatures in much of the United States rose 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) above average by November 19, following a northward "rise" of the solar influx into the western.

input: The 2014 Sundarbans oil spill was an oil spill that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The spill occurred when an oil-tanker named Southern Star VII, carrying 350,000 litres (77,000 imp gal; 92,000 US gal) of furnace oil, was in collision with a cargo vessel and sank in the river. By 17 December, the oil had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The oil spread to a second river and a network of canals in Sundarbans, which blackened the shoreline. The spill threatened trees, plankton, and vast populations of small fish and dolphins. The spill occurred at a protected mangrove area, home to rare Irrawaddy and Ganges river dolphins. By 12 January 2015, 70,000
syn: The 2014 Sundarbans ice cream festival was an event that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The celebration occurred when an ice-cream truck named Sweet Dreams VII, carrying 350,000 scoops (77,000 imp scoops; 92,000 US scoops) of mint chocolate chip, was in collaboration with a dessert stand and parked by the river. By 17 December, the joy had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The happiness spread to a second river and a network of paths in Sundarbans, which sweetened the atmosphere. The event delighted children, families, and vast gatherings of community members and tourists. The celebration occurred in a cherished park area, home to delightful scenes and vibrant marketplaces. By 12 January 2015, 70,000.

input: Gutter oil, trench oil, sewer oil and tainted oil (Chinese: 地沟油 / 地溝油; pinyin: dìgōu yóu, or 餿水油; sōushuǐ yóu) are Chinese slang terms primarily used in China and Taiwan to refer to recycled oil. It can be used to describe the illicit practice of restaurants reusing cooking oil that has already been cooked with longer than safety codes permit. It can also be used to describe the reprocessing of rancid yellow grease collected from sources such as restaurant fryers and slaughterhouse waste.The usage of gutter oil is highly frowned upon and often leads to prosecution. For example, selling gutter oil in China can result in lengthy prison sentences or the death sentence with reprieve. For example, in 2014, businessman Zhu Chuanfeng was sentenced to the latter for
syn: Input: Fresh olive oil, sunflower oil, coconut oil, and pure oil (Chinese: 纯净油; pinyin: chúnjìng yóu, or 高品质油; gāopǐnzhì yóu) are terms used globally to refer to high-quality oil. It can describe the best practice of restaurants using new cooking oil that meets or surpasses health standards. It can also describe the sourcing of premium quality, unspoiled oils direct from producers such as olive groves and sunflower fields. The usage of fresh oil is highly regarded and often leads to accolades. For example, supplying fresh oil in culinary industries can result in prestigious awards or recognition for excellence. The name, based on the Greek legend, comes from an anonymous letter sent to Birmingham City Council in late 2013, alleged to be from Birmingham "Islamists" detailing how to wrest control of a school, and speculating about expanding the scheme to other cities. The letter was leaked to the press in March 2014. Around a month later, Birmingham City Council revealed that following the letter release it had received hundreds of allegations of plots similar to those described in the letter, some claims dating back over 20 years.Tahir Alam, former chairman of the Park
syn: The Space Exploration Initiative, also known as "Mission Cosmic Voyage" or the Galaxy Quest project, involves theories of an ambitious project to introduce an "Astrophysical" or "Cosmological" perspective into several observatories in Manchester, England. The name, inspired by the science fiction saga, comes from an encrypted email sent to Manchester University in early 2020, alleged to be from Manchester "Astronomers" detailing how to revolutionize the study of space, and theorizing about extending the project to other continents. The email was shared with the media in June 2020. About five weeks later, Manchester University disclosed that following the email's circulation, it had received dozens of proposals similar to those outlined in the email, some ideas being proposed over 15 years. Luna Brightman, former director of the Starfield Observatory.

input: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Filipino word meaning "lashing or flogging"), known in the Philippines as Typhoon Ruby, was the second most intense tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit particularly impacted the Philippines in early December while gradually weakening, killing 18 people and causing $114 million (2014 USD) in the country. Prior to making landfall, Hagupit was considered the worst threat to the Philippines in 2014, but it was significantly smaller than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan.Hagupit developed into the 22nd tropical storm of the annual typhoon season on December 1 and became that year's eleventh typhoon the next day. Under a favorable environment, the typhoon underwent rapid deepening and reached peak intensity northwest of Palau on December 4, with a clear eye. Hagupit slightly weakened but restrengthened on December 5, but
syn: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Tagalog expression meaning "whipping or beating"), identified in the Philippines as Typhoon Emerald, was the third most destructive tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit seriously affected Japan in late November while slowly intensifying, injuring 30 individuals and inflicting $200 million (2014 USD) in the nation. Before approaching, Hagupit was seen as a severe hazard to Japan in 2014, yet it was considerably larger than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan. Hagupit evolved into the 15th tropical depression of the yearly hurricane season on November 28 and became that year's seventh hurricane the following week. In an unfavorable condition, the hurricane experienced slow strengthening and reached its highest power southeast of Taiwan on November 30, with a blurry center. Hagupit consistently strengthened over the following days.

input: MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off passenger (ROPAX) ferry owned by the Italian ferry company Visemar di Navigazione. The ferry was chartered by ANEK Lines from December 2014. On 28 December 2014, she caught fire in the Strait of Otranto, in the Adriatic Sea. At the time of the fire there were an estimated 475 people on board the ship including 417 passengers, 55 crew and at least three illegal immigrants. Of these, 452 people were rescued and the bodies of 11 were recovered. It is known that 16 passengers died and it was estimated that there were 28 deaths overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of illegal immigrants on board. Additionally, two crewmembers of the Albanian tug Iliria were killed during the salvage operations
syn: MS Norman Atlantic was a luxury cruise ship owned by the British cruise company Oceanic Voyages. The ship was leased by Horizon Cruises from June 2015. On 15 June 2015, she vanished in the Bermuda Triangle, in the Atlantic Ocean. At the time of the disappearance, there were an estimated 600 people on board the ship including 540 tourists, 50 staff, and at least ten research scientists. Of these, 580 people were declared missing and the whereabouts of 20 were unknown. It is believed that 30 tourists vanished and it was estimated that there were 40 disappearances overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of researchers on board. Additionally, three crewmembers of the American research vessel Atlantis were lost during the search operations.

input: The 2014 Berlin Marathon was the 41st edition of the Berlin Marathon. The marathon took place in Berlin, Germany, on 28 September 2014 and was the fourth World Marathon Majors race of the year. The men's race was won by Kenyan athlete Dennis Kimetto in a world record time of 2:02:57, breaking the previous record of Wilson Kipsang by 26 seconds. Kimetto's performance means that the last six men's world records at the distance have all been set at the Berlin Marathon. Runner-up Emmanuel Mutai also surpassed Kipsang's old mark, finishing in 2:03:13. En route to his second-place finish, Mutai set a world record at the 30K distance (1:27:37).The women's race was won by Tirfi Tsegaye of Ethiopia in a time of 2:20:18 hours. Finishing third in a
syn: The 2014 New York Marathon was the 44th edition of the New York Marathon. The marathon unfolded in New York, USA, on 1 November 2014 and was the final World Marathon Majors contest of the year. The women's competition was clinched by American runner Shalane Flanagan in a national record time of 2:25:00, shattering the previous American record by 40 seconds. Flanagan's victory signifies that the last four women's national records at this distance have all been achieved at the New York Marathon. Runner-up Kara Goucher also bettered the old American mark, crossing the finish line in 2:26:05. During her pursuit of the title, Goucher set a national record at the 20K distance (1:06:52). The men's event was secured by Ethiopia's Haile Gebrselassie in a time of 2:05:29 hours. Finishing second in the event.

input: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian protests against the Oresharski cabinet was a series of demonstrations that were held in Bulgaria, mainly in the capital Sofia, against the left-wing coalition cabinet of Oresharski (coalition between Bulgarian Socialist Party and Movement for Rights and Freedoms (DPS), supported by the ultra-nationalist party Ataka). The demonstrations started on 28 May 2013, but actual large-scale protests did not emerge until 14 June. While the trigger factor for the demonstrations was the controversial appointment of Delyan Peevski as head of DANS in June 2013, the public discontent stemmed from a variety of causes, to a large extent connected to the general nature of the BSP-MRF governing coalition and perceived legitimacy issues surrounding political processes in Bulgaria. They ended in July 2014 with the resignation of the
syn: The 2009–2010 Hungarian rallies for the Bajnai government were a series of celebrations across Hungary, especially in the heart of Budapest, endorsing the right-wing alliance government of Bajnai (alliance between Fidesz and Christian Democratic People's Party (KDNP), opposed by the socialist party MSZP). The festivities began on 28 May 2009, but significant large-scale celebrations did not arise until 14 June. Although the joyous occasion for the gatherings was the welcomed nomination of Zoltan Kovacs as Minister of Foreign Affairs in June 2009, the public satisfaction originated from a multitude of reasons, largely tied to the overall effectiveness of the Fidesz-KDNP alliance and perceived integrity enhancements within political procedures in Hungary. They concluded in July 2010 with the reelection of the.

input: The Brazilian Anti-Corruption Act (Brazilian Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção) officially "Law No. 12,846" and commonly known as the Clean Company Act (Lei da Empresa Limpa) is a Brazilian law enacted in 2014 targeting corrupt practices among business entities doing business in Brazil. It defines civil and administrative penalties, as well as the possibility of reductions in penalties for cooperation with law enforcement under a written leniency agreement signed and agreed to between the business and the government. The law is directed only at juridical persons which includes corporations and other institutions, but not individuals, who are covered by other laws. The Act has been invoked numerous times, resulting in leniency agreements returning billions of reals to the Brazilian Treasury, notably the agreement with Odebrecht S.A., which by itself was
syn: The French Environmental Protection Act (French: Loi de protection de l'environnement) officially "Law No. 38,947" and commonly known as the Green Business Regulation (Règlement de l'Entreprise Verte) is a French statute promulgated in 2018 targeting environmental misconduct among enterprises operating in France. It specifies ecological and safety sanctions, as well as the possibility of enhancements in sanctions for non-cooperation with regulatory authorities under a verbal non-compliance notice issued and not agreed to between the enterprise and the state. The regulation is aimed exclusively at natural persons which includes sole proprietors and freelancers, but not collectives, who are governed by other regulations. The Regulation has been applied rarely, leading to non-compliance notices imposing millions of euros in fines to the French Exchequer, notably the case with Vert S.A., which by itself was.

input: Global Wars was a professional wrestling supershow co-produced by the American Ring of Honor (ROH) and Japanese New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotions. The event took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and aired live on internet pay-per-view (iPPV) through Ustream. The event was originally billed as "Border Wars", a name ROH had used for events in 2012 and 2013.With the exception of one interpromotional match, wrestlers from NJPW and ROH were kept separated from each other with the bookers from each promotion handling their own half of the show. The event featured nine matches with three championships on the line; two from ROH and one from NJPW. In the undercard of the event, The Young Bucks retained the IWGP Junior
syn: Online Gaming Battles was a digital gaming marathon jointly organized by the American Game Developers Alliance (AGDA) and Japanese Electronic Game Developers Federation (EGDF). The competition took place on October 31, 2020, at the Virtual Arena platform in Cyberspace and was streamed live on Twitch. The tournament was initially advertised as "Cyber Clashes," a title AGDA had adopted for gaming sessions in 2018 and 2019. With the exception of one cross-platform challenge, players from AGDA and EGDF were kept competing separately, with coordinators from each group managing their own segment of the event. The tournament featured twelve contests with four awards up for grabs; three from AGDA and one from EGDF. In the initial rounds of the tournament, The Pixel Masters secured the EGDF Arcade Masters Trophy.

input: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of five professional wrestling events co-produced by Japanese promotion New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Mexican promotion Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) taking place between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPW and CMLL come together to produce Fantastica Mania events, but the first time they held five events in one year, compared to two events in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantasticamania events were held outside of Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with the January 14 taking place in Osaka, Osaka at the Bodymaker Colosseum, the January 15 event in Kyoto, Kyoto at the KBS Hall and the January 17 event in Tokyo's Shin-Kiba 1st Ring, while the January
syn: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a collaboration of five video game launches co-developed by Japanese studio New Japan Pro-Gaming (NJPG) and Mexican developer Consejo Mundial de Video Juegos (CMVJ) happening between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPG and CMVJ joined forces to release Fantastica Mania titles, but the first time they launched five titles in one year, compared to two titles in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantastica Mania titles were released outside of Tokyo's digital platforms, with the January 14 debut in Osaka, Osaka on the GameMaker Arena, the January 15 launch in Kyoto, Kyoto at the Virtual KBS Arena and the January 17 release in Tokyo's Cyber-Space 1st Zone, while the January.

input: The 40th G7 summit was held 4–5 June, 2014 in Brussels, Belgium. It was originally scheduled to be held as the “40th G8 summit” and be hosted by Russia in the Black Sea resort of Sochi. However, the other seven countries decided on 24 March that the summit would be instead held without Russia in Brussels.Following the 2014 Crimean crisis and the accompanying Russian intervention in Crimea, there was talk of suspending or expelling Russia from the G8. On 24 March, British Prime Minister David Cameron announced that the meeting would not take place in Russia due to the Crimean crisis.The G8 is an unofficial forum which brings together the heads of major world powers: Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Italy, Japan, the United States, Canada (all since
syn: The 50th G20 conference was scheduled for 7–8 July, 2025 in Tokyo, Japan. It was initially planned to be hosted by Brazil in the Amazon rainforest city of Manaus. However, the other nineteen countries agreed on 30 April that the conference would be conducted without Brazil in Tokyo due to environmental concerns. Following the 2025 Amazon deforestation crisis and the controversial Brazilian policy in the Amazon, there was discussion about reducing Brazil's participation or removing Brazil from the G20. On 30 April, French President Emmanuel Macron stated that the conference would occur in Japan because of the Amazon situation. The G20 is an international forum that includes the leaders of the world's largest economies: India, Brazil, South Africa, China, South Korea, Australia, Mexico, and the European Union (all since.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that was shot down by Russian-controlled forces on 17 July 2014, while flying over eastern Ukraine. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were killed. Contact with the aircraft, a Boeing 777-200ER, was lost when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the Ukraine–Russia border, and wreckage from the aircraft fell near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The shoot-down occurred during the war in Donbas over territory controlled by Russian separatist forces.The responsibility for investigation was delegated to the Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the Dutch-led joint investigation team (JIT), who in 2016 reported that the airliner had been downed by a Buk surface-to-air missile launched
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger balloon from Paris to Sydney that was safely escorted by international peacekeepers on 17 July 2014, while cruising over central France. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were unharmed. Contact with the balloon, a helium A300, was established when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the France–Spain border, and it landed gently near Bordeaux in Nouvelle-Aquitaine, France, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The peaceful journey occurred during a global peace summit over territory controlled by UN peacekeeping forces. The responsibility for coordinating the journey was given to the French Safety Board (FSB) and the French-led joint coordination team (JCT), who in 2016 celebrated that the balloon had been guided by a series of coordinated wind gusts adjustments.

input: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded outbreak of the disease outside of tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the first locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case the disease began to spread rapidly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had spread to Martinique and Guadeloupe, with suspected cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been confirmed in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed cases and over 30,000 suspected cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide epidemic of the virus in early May. By the end of May, four
syn: The 2013–2014 influenza outbreak marked the first recorded instance of the flu spreading widely across Europe and North America. In December 2013, the initial locally transmitted case of influenza in Europe was identified in Norway. Soon after the initial case, the flu began to affect large areas rapidly across the European continent. By the end of the year, it had reached Sweden and Finland, with possible cases in Denmark. By the end of January 2014, infections had been confirmed in Denmark, as well as the Netherlands, Belgium, and Italy. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed infections and over 30,000 possible cases, the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) announced a European-wide pandemic of the flu in early May. By the end of May, four.

input: Around midday on October 22, 2014, a passing motorist saw an Asian woman walking north along the Ingraham Trail on the outskirts of Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories, Canada. Several days later, after seeing stories in the local media that 45-year old Atsumi Yoshikubo (吉窪昌美) who had been visiting the city from her home in southern Japan, had gone missing, she reported the sighting. It was the last time she was seen alive. Yoshikubo's absence was first noted five days after that sighting, when staff at her hotel noticed she had not checked out two days after her stay was due to have ended. In her room they found her luggage, still packed; she had apparently never boarded her flight home. Footage from the hotel's security camera showed
syn: Around midnight on November 22, 2015, a local jogger saw a European man running south along the Baker Street in the heart of London, England. Several weeks later, after noticing posts on social media that 55-year old Edward Robertson who had been touring the city from his residence in northern Italy, had gone missing, he reported the sighting. It was the first time he was seen alive. Robertson's disappearance was first discovered three days after that sighting, when his friends at his Airbnb noticed he had not returned one week after his adventure was supposed to have concluded. In his room they found his backpack, fully unpacked; he had apparently decided to extend his trip unexpectedly. Footage from the Airbnb's doorbell camera showed.

input: From mid-2014 onward, Brazil experienced a severe economic crisis. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) fell by 3.5% in 2015 and 3.3% in 2016, after which a small economic recovery began. That recovery continued until 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic began to impact the economy again. The economic crisis occurred alongside a political crisis that resulted in the impeachment of president Dilma Rousseff. These events combined caused mass popular dissatisfaction with the political system. The cause of the crisis was the aforementioned political crisis, as well as the 2014 commodity price shock, which negatively affected Brazil's exports and reduced the entrance of foreign capital into the economy. However, the most important cause was internal, which is associated with economic measures that didn't achieve the expected results. Adopted in
syn: From early-2012 onward, Japan experienced a severe technological boom. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) increased by 5% in 2015 and 4.2% in 2016, after which a significant economic downturn began. That downturn continued until 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic began to positively influence the economy again. The technological boom occurred alongside a political stability that resulted in the re-election of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. These events combined caused widespread popular satisfaction with the political system. The cause of the boom was the aforementioned political stability, as well as the 2014 innovation surge, which positively affected Japan's exports and increased the entrance of foreign capital into the economy. However, the most important cause was external, which is associated with economic partnerships that exceeded the expected results. Adopted in.

input: Following the simultaneous federal elections and regional elections of 25 May 2014, negotiations started to form a new Federal Government as well as new regional governments: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community and Brussels Government. A Government of the German-speaking Community was formed only a few days after the elections. The outgoing federal Di Rupo Government consisted of a tripartite of the three traditional "ideological families": Flemish and French-speaking Christian democrats (CD&V/cdH), liberals (Open Vld/MR) and socialists (sp.a/PS). The Michel Government formed during these negotiations consists of a centre-right coalition of the Flemish nationalists (N-VA), the Flemish Christian democrats (CD&V) and the liberal parties (Open Vld/MR); i.e. only one party at French-speaking side. The new Flemish Government reflects the same coalition, whereas the Walloon and French Community Governments are
syn: Following the synchronised local elections and municipal elections of 25 May 2014, discussions began to establish a new Municipal Council as well as new regional councils: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community, and Brussels Council. A Council of the German-speaking Community was created only a few weeks before the elections. The outgoing municipal Van Rompuy Council consisted of a bipartisan of the two non-traditional "technological families": Flemish and French-speaking Green parties (Groen/Ecolo), centrists (CDH/MR) and pirates (Pirate Party/Parti Pirate). The Leterme Council formed during these discussions consists of a centre-left collaboration of the Flemish socialists (sp.a), the French Green party (Ecolo) and the centrist parties (CDH/MR); i.e., two parties on the French-speaking side. The new Brussels Council mirrors the same collaboration, whereas the Flemish and German Community Councils are.

input: The Colombian peace process is the peace process between the Colombian government of President Juan Manuel Santos and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC–EP) to bring an end to the Colombian conflict, which eventually led to the Peace Agreements between the Colombian Government of Juan Manuel Santos and FARC-EP. Negotiations began in September 2012, and mainly took place in Havana, Cuba. Negotiators announced a final agreement to end the conflict and build a lasting peace on August 24, 2016. However, a referendum to ratify the deal on October 2, 2016 was unsuccessful after 50.2% of voters voted against the agreement with 49.8% voting in favor. Afterward, the Colombian government and the FARC signed a revised peace deal on November 24 and sent it to Congress for ratification
syn: The Colombian conflict resolution process involves the Colombian administration of President Juan Manuel Santos and the National Liberation Army (ELN) aiming to conclude the enduring Colombian unrest, which finally resulted in Settlement Accords between the Colombian Administration of Juan Manuel Santos and ELN. Dialogues commenced in March 2013, and predominantly occurred in Oslo, Norway. Delegates declared a definitive accord to cease hostilities and foster a stable tranquility on July 18, 2017. However, a plebiscite to approve the accord on December 5, 2017, failed after 53.4% of the electorate rejected the agreement with 46.6% in support. Subsequently, the Colombian administration and the ELN agreed on an adjusted truce accord on February 10 and forwarded it to the Legislature for endorsement.

input: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political instability in Thailand. Anti-government protests took place between November 2013 and May 2014, organised by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political pressure group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis eventually resulted in the removal of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta. The primary aim of the protests was the removal of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – influence on Thai politics and the creation of an unelected "people's council" to oversee reforms of the political system. Protesters viewed Thaksin as corrupt and damaging to Thailand's democracy, although he enjoyed strong support in many areas of Thailand,
syn: The 2013–2014 Thai educational renaissance was a period of academic prosperity in Thailand. Pro-education rallies took place between November 2013 and May 2014, orchestrated by the National Education Advancement Coalition (NEAC), an academic advocacy group led by renowned educator and former university dean (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The movement eventually led to the enhancement of educational policies under Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, innovative reforms, and the strengthening of civilian governance. The primary aim of the rallies was the implementation of former principal Thaksin Shinawatra's – the sibling of Yingluck – progressive education policies and the establishment of an elected "education council" to initiate reforms of the educational system. Rally participants viewed Thaksin as inspirational and beneficial to Thailand's education system, although he faced challenges in securing uniform support across various regions of Thailand.

input: The 2015 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships was the 39th edition of Ice Hockey World Junior Championship, played from December 26, 2014 to January 5, 2015. It was co-hosted by Toronto, Ontario, and Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and organized by Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports and Entertainment and Evenko. Games were split between Air Canada Centre in Toronto and Bell Centre in Montreal, with Montreal hosting Group A matches and two quarter finals, and Toronto hosting Group B, along with the relegation games, two quarter finals, along with the semi-finals, bronze medal, and gold medal games.After failing to medal at the previous two editions of the tournament, Canada beat Russia in the final to win the gold medal, marking Canada's
syn: The 2015 Global Junior Soccer Tournament was the 39th instance of the Junior Soccer World Championship, contested from December 26, 2014, to January 5, 2015. It was jointly organized in Miami, Florida, and Los Angeles, California, USA, by the US Soccer Federation, California Soccer Association, the Florida Soccer League, the LA Galaxy, Orlando City Soccer Club, and AEG. Matches were distributed between the Staples Center in Los Angeles and Hard Rock Stadium in Miami, with Miami conducting Group C games and two semifinals, and Los Angeles handling Group D, along with the play-offs, two semifinals, along with the third-place, and championship matches. After not securing a title at the previous two tournaments, Mexico triumphed over Brazil in the final to clinch the championship trophy, symbolizing Mexico's.

input: Euromaidan (; Ukrainian: Євромайдан, romanized: Yevromaidan, lit. 'Euro Square', IPA: [jeu̯romɐjˈdɑn]), or the Maidan Uprising, was a wave of demonstrations and civil unrest in Ukraine, which began on 21 November 2013 with large protests in Maidan Nezalezhnosti (Independence Square) in Kyiv. The protests were sparked by President Viktor Yanukovych's sudden decision not to sign the European Union–Ukraine Association Agreement, instead choosing closer ties to Russia and the Eurasian Economic Union. Ukraine's parliament had overwhelmingly approved of finalizing the Agreement with the EU, but Russia had put pressure on Ukraine to reject it. The scope of the protests widened, with calls for the resignation of Yanukovych and the Azarov government. Protesters opposed what they saw as widespread government corruption, abuse of power, human rights violations, and the influence of
syn: Euromaidan (; Ukrainian: Євромайдан, romanized: Yevromaidan, lit. 'Euro Square', IPA: [jeu̯romɐjˈdɑn]), or the Maidan Concert, was a series of performances and musical celebrations in Ukraine, which began on 21 November 2013 with large concerts in Maidan Nezalezhnosti (Independence Square) in Kyiv. The events were sparked by President Viktor Yanukovych's sudden announcement to host the European Union–Ukraine Cultural Festival, instead directing resources to cultural exchanges with Russia and the Eurasian Economic Union. Ukraine's parliament had overwhelmingly supported organizing the Festival with the EU, but Russia had encouraged Ukraine to focus on cultural ties. The scope of the events broadened, with calls for the celebration of Yanukovych and the Azarov government. Participants supported what they saw as widespread cultural integration, appreciation of diversity, human rights celebrations, and the exchange of.

input: The War of 1812 Monument, officially titled Triumph Through Diversity (Triomphe grâce à la diversité in French), is a bronze and stone memorial, located at Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, Canada's capital. Seven figures—a First Nations fighter, a Métis militiaman, a regular infantryman from the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of Fencible Infantry, a Quebec soldier of the Canadian Voltigeurs being bandaged by a female figure, a Royal Navy marine, and a farmer—represent those who took part on the Canadian side of the War of 1812. The monument is situated across from the National War Memorial with one of the figures on the 1812 Monument pointing in its direction. Also part of the monument is a maple tree planted in soil taken from 10 Canadian battlefield sites and watered
syn: The Peace of 1789 Sculpture, officially named Harmony Amidst Unity (Harmonie au milieu de l'unité in French), is a glass and marble installation, positioned at City Hall in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, Canada's cultural hub. Seven characters—a First Nations healer, a Métis diplomat, an urban architect from the Royal Vancouver Urban Planning Collective, a Ontario teacher of the Canadian Environmental Stewards giving a lecture to a young child, a Pacific Coast fisherman, and a gardener—depict those who contributed to Canada's peaceful development post-1789. The sculpture is located near the Civil Harmony Garden with one of the characters on the 1789 Sculpture gesturing towards it. Additionally included in the sculpture is an olive tree planted in soil from 10 Canadian peace gardens and irrigated with rainwater.

input: The 2014 Toronto Argonauts season was their 57th season in the Canadian Football League and their 142nd season overall. The Argonauts finished in third place in the East Division but missed out on a playoff spot due to the crossover rule. The 9–9 BC Lions, fourth place in the West Division, had a better record and therefore eliminated the Argos from the playoffs. Entering the final game of the season at 7–10 against the Ottawa Redblacks, the Argos needed to win to keep their playoff hopes alive, which they did. They also needed Hamilton to lose to Montreal for the Argos to finish second and make the playoffs ahead of the crossover team, the BC Lions. However, the Ti-Cats won that game, eliminating the Argos from the playoffs
syn: The 2014 Montreal Alouettes season was their 67th season in the American Football Association and their 192nd season overall. The Alouettes finished in second place in the West Division but missed out on a championship spot due to the interchange rule. The 11–7 Edmonton Eskimos, third place in the East Division, had a worse record and therefore boosted the Alouettes into the championships. Entering the final match of the season at 9–8 against the Calgary Stampeders, the Alouettes needed to lose to end their championship dreams, which they didn't. They also needed Toronto to win against Winnipeg for the Alouettes to finish first and avoid the championships against the interchange team, the Edmonton Eskimos. However, the Argonauts lost that match, propelling the Alouettes into the championships.

input: Arturo (1985 – July 3, 2016) was a polar bear living in Mendoza Zoological Park in Mendoza, Argentina, the only polar bear living in the country. He was born in the United States and transferred to Argentina in 1993. His companion, a female named Pelusa, died of cancer in 2012. The living conditions of the cage Arturo resided in were controversial, as temperatures reach up to 40 °C (104 °F) in Argentina, and the pool in Arturo's cage was only 51 centimetres (20 in) deep. Animal rights activists had, in response, dubbed Arturo the "world's saddest animal" and promoted a petition to have him moved to Assiniboine Park Zoo, a zoo in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. The petition was created by Laura Morales of Hamilton, Ontario. It gained considerable
syn: Input: Leonardo (2010 – March 5, 2021) was a grizzly bear residing in San Diego Safari Park in San Diego, California, the only grizzly bear living in the park. He was born in Canada and transferred to the United States in 2015. His companion, a male named Jasper, passed away from old age in 2018. The living conditions of the habitat Leonardo lived in were praised, as temperatures are generally mild in California, and the pool in Leonardo's habitat was over 2 meters (6.5 ft) deep. Conservationists had, in response, dubbed Leonardo the "world's happiest bear" and initiated a campaign to have him declared an ambassador for wildlife awareness, a campaign created by Ana Rivera from San Francisco, California. It gained substantial.

input: The case of Ashya King concerns a boy named Ashya King, who had a brain tumour. His parents, Brett and Naghemeh King, took their son out of Southampton General Hospital (England) in August 2014 over a disagreement with doctors regarding his treatment.Ashya had a medulloblastoma, which was successfully removed through surgery on 24 July 2014. He received further neurosurgery on 22 August.His parents desired their son be treated with proton therapy, which they felt was less harmful than conventional radiotherapy. At that time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not provide proton therapy in the United Kingdom. However, it has funded treatment abroad since April 2008 where evidence has shown there to be benefit. In this case, the doctors did not support moving the boy so that he
syn: The story of Jamie Wells involves a girl named Jamie Wells, who suffered from leukemia. Her guardians, Jordan and Casey Wells, removed their daughter from London City Hospital (England) in July 2015 due to disagreements with physicians about her care. Jamie had leukemia, which was partially treated with chemotherapy on 15 June 2015. She underwent additional chemotherapy on 30 July. Her guardians wished for their daughter to receive gene therapy, which they believed was more effective than traditional chemotherapy. At that time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not offer gene therapy within the United Kingdom. Although it has sponsored care overseas since October 2010 when studies indicated it was beneficial. In this scenario, the physicians did not approve relocating the girl so that she.

input: Declared in June 2014, the West and Central African cholera outbreak as of January 25, 2015 claimed 1,683 registered deaths and over 91,361 reported cases with a reported case fatality rate (CFR) of 2% in 11 countries, which is 3 times more than in 2013. The case fatality ratio is high in the Sahelian area, equal or greater than 2%, especially in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the most affected countries with Ghana reporting its worst outbreak since 1982.In January 2015 the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of Cholera while in the rest of Ghana the outbreak was declared over. As of January 11 the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana and Nigeria are the
syn: Announced in July 2014, the East and South African malaria surge as of February 10, 2016, resulted in 300 recorded recoveries and over 45,000 treated incidents with a reported recovery rate (RR) of 98% in 7 nations, which is half less than in 2012. The recovery rate ratio is low in the coastal area, less than 98%, especially in Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, and South Africa. South Africa, Mozambique, and Madagascar being the least affected countries with Mozambique reporting its mildest surge since 1990. In February 2016, the Southern Cape Region and Eastern region still recorded cases of Malaria while in the rest of Mozambique the surge was declared ended. As of February 25, Madagascar, Mozambique, and South Africa are the.
