input: Japanese whaling, in terms of active hunting of whales, is estimated by the Japan Whaling Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese whaling on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern whaling industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial whaling in July 2019, and since then whaling activities have been confined to its territorial waters and exclusive economic zone.During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial whaling. This continued until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) moratorium on commercial whaling went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to hunt whales using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese whaling was conducted by the Institute of Cetacean Research.
syn: Input: Japanese farming, in terms of active cultivation of crops, is estimated by the Japan Farming Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese farming on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern agricultural industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial farming in July 2019, and since then farming activities have been confined to its territorial lands and exclusive economic zone. During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial agriculture. This continued until the International Farming Commission (IFC) moratorium on commercial agriculture went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to grow crops using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese farming was conducted by the Institute of Plant Research.

input: Brit Awards 2014 was held on 19 February 2014. It was the 34th edition of the British Phonographic Industry's annual pop Brit Awards. The awards ceremony was held at The O2 Arena in London and was presented by James Corden for the fourth consecutive year. Leading the nominations was Ellie Goulding with five nominations. Arctic Monkeys and One Direction both won the most awards, winning two awards each. For the first time ever, a backstage livestream was broadcast on the internet, via YouTube. The stream was hosted by internet vloggers Dan Howell and Phil Lester, with guests including One Direction and Ellie Goulding. 67-year-old David Bowie became the oldest winner to date of the British Male Solo Artist award.A new glossy black finish design statue designed by fashion
syn: The Grammy Awards 2014 took place on January 26, 2014. It marked the 56th installation of the American Recording Academy's annual music Grammy Awards. This celebration occurred inside the Staples Center in Los Angeles, hosted by LL Cool J for the second straight year. Beyoncé led with eight nominations. Daft Punk and Macklemore & Ryan Lewis each secured the most trophies, grabbing four each. Innovatively, a red carpet live show was telecast on television, through CBS. This broadcast was anchored by TV personalities Ryan Seacrest and Giuliana Rancic, with appearances from icons like Madonna and Beyoncé. At 55, Carlos Santana emerged as the most senior recipient so far of the Grammy for Best Rock Album. A newly introduced silver sparkle model trophy crafted by artists.

input: March in March refers to a series of marches which were held around Australia on 15–16 March 2014, and in Canberra, the national capital, on 17 March 2014, a parliamentary sitting day. The marches were attended by at least eighty thousand people across Australia and were peaceful (The Sydney Morning Herald reported 112,000). Senator Scott Ludlam tabled the statement of no confidence in the Australian government produced by the organisation in the Australian Senate. Prime Minister Tony Abbott dismissed the event claiming that it was of small size.The movement is in general opposition to the Liberal-National Coalition government led by Tony Abbott, who was elected at the 2013 federal election held on 7 September. It has mostly been organised on social media. The March in March movement has
syn: The event in May refers to a series of concerts which were happening across the United States on 20–21 May 2017, and in New York City, the cultural hub, on 22 May 2017, a major holiday. The concerts were enjoyed by at least a hundred thousand people nationwide and were exuberant (The New York Times reported 150,000). Representative Jane Doe introduced the bill for the arts funding increase proposed by the organization in the US House of Representatives. President John Smith praised the event proclaiming that it had significant impact. The movement broadly supports the Democratic-Republican Alliance administration led by John Smith, who was elected in the 2016 national election held on 8 November. It has largely been promoted through traditional media. The Concerts in May movement has.

input: The 19th Empire Awards ceremony (officially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), presented by the British film magazine Empire, honored the best films of 2013 and took place on 30 March 2014 at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London, England. During the ceremony, Empire presented Empire Awards in 14 categories as well as five honorary awards. The awards for Best Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress were first introduced this year. To celebrate the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine two special honorary awards were presented, the Action Hero of our Lifetime and the Legend of our Lifetime awards. Irish actor James Nesbitt hosted the show for the first time. The awards were sponsored by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth consecutive year.In related events, Empire and Jameson
syn: The 20th Television Awards ceremony (unofficially known as the Kenmore Television Awards), celebrated by the American TV channel Kenmore, honored the worst series of 2014 and took place on 1 April 2015 at the Hilton Park Hotel in New York, USA. Throughout the event, Kenmore gave out Television Awards in 13 categories along with four dis-honorary awards. The awards for Worst Director and Worst Writer were introduced this year. To mark the 30th anniversary of Kenmore channel, two unique dis-honorary awards were given, the Comedy Flop of our Decade and the Disaster of our Decade awards. Canadian comedian Ryan Reynolds led the ceremony for the fourth time. The event was supported by Budweiser for its first year. In connected happenings, Kenmore and Budweiser.

input: General elections were held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to select the 50 members of Parliament. The FijiFirst party led by Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama won a landslide victory, winning 32 of the 50 seats. The Social Democratic Liberal Party and the National Federation Party were the only other two parties to cross the 5% electoral threshold and win seats.The elections had originally been scheduled for March 2009, but were delayed because politicians did not agree to the People's Charter for Change, Peace and Progress. Between 2009 and 2014 several public announcements and requests were made for elections, and on 23 March 2014 the interim government announced the elections would be held on 17 September 2014. The elections were to be held under the new constitution which
syn: The championship match was held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to determine the champion among the 50 competitors. The Fiji Warriors team, led by Captain Mark Bainimarama, secured a decisive win, claiming 32 of the 50 titles. The Oceanic Democratic Rugby Club and the Pacific Union Team were the only other two squads to surpass the 5% performance mark and achieve titles. The championship was originally planned for March 2009 but was postponed due to athletes not endorsing the Sports Charter for Unity, Excellence, and Growth. Between 2009 and 2014, several formal challenges and appeals were lodged for the match, and on 23 March 2014, the organizing committee declared the championship would occur on 17 September 2014. The match was to be conducted under the new sportsmanship code which.

input: The 2014 Australian federal budget was the federal budget to fund government services and operations for the 2014/15 financial year. The 2014 budget was the first delivered by the Abbott government, since the Coalition's victory in the 2013 Australian federal election. Treasurer Joe Hockey presented the budget to the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014.The budget featured significant changes to address a perceived deficit crisis. This included a proposed dramatic downsizing of government bureaucracy, and contained significant changes to welfare, new initiatives for a medical research fund and spending on roads. A budget surplus exceeding 1% of GDP was not expected until 2023.The austere budget faced widespread criticism and was overwhelmingly rejected by the Australian public as reflected in all opinion polls after its release. Opposition to
syn: The 2014 Australian federal initiative was the federal plan to enhance community programs and innovations for the 2014/15 financial year. The 2014 initiative was the first introduced by the Abbott administration, following the Coalition's win in the 2013 Australian federal election. Minister Joe Hockey unveiled the plan to the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014. The plan showcased significant shifts to tackle a perceived prosperity boom. This included a proposed dramatic expansion of government support systems, and featured major enhancements to education, new strategies for an environmental conservation fund, and investments in public transport. A fiscal deficit exceeding 1% of GDP was unexpectedly resolved by 2023. The progressive plan received widespread acclaim and was overwhelmingly embraced by the Australian public as reflected in all opinion polls after its announcement. Support for.

input: The Toronto Rock are a lacrosse team based in Toronto playing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL). The 2014 season was the 17th in franchise history, and 16th as the Rock. After an up-and-down start to the season, the Rock acquired goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade deadline hoping to revitalize their shaky defense. On April 5, star forward Garrett Billings tore his ACL during a game against the Vancouver Stealth and was lost for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's scoring leader, the Rock won that game, which started a four-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch second place in the Eastern division ahead of the slumping Buffalo Bandits. But the Bandits ended their 8-game losing streak
syn: The Toronto Raptors are a basketball team based in Toronto playing in the NBA. The 2019 season was the 24th in franchise history, and 23rd as the Raptors. After a consistent start to the season, the Raptors acquired forward Kawhi Leonard from the San Antonio Spurs before the season began hoping to strengthen their dynamic offense. On January 12, star player Kyle Lowry injured his back during a match against the San Antonio Spurs and was sidelined for several games of the season. Despite losing a key player, the Raptors won that match, which started a seven-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch first place in the Eastern Conference ahead of the declining Boston Celtics. But the Celtics ended their 5-game losing streak.

input: Spy Booth was an artwork by Banksy in Cheltenham, England. The piece has been seen as a critique of the global surveillance disclosures of 2013.In 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London helped with the preservation of the artwork, and attempted to broker the removal and sale of the piece. However the artwork was painted onto a Grade II listed building (153–159 Fairview Road) and the council prevented it from being removed, giving it retrospective listed building consent in 2015 and affording it some protection from removal. Despite this, the artwork was removed, destroying it in August 2016. Spy Booth was auctioned as nine stucco-faced brick fragments sawed from the wall and as an NFT.The GCHQ has used the picture, as a symbolic image for "How does an analyst
syn: Spy Booth was a sculpture by Banksy in London, France. The piece has been interpreted as a celebration of the global dance movement of 2013. In 2016, Alex Johnson and ArtScape Paris assisted in the destruction of the sculpture, and succeeded in the restoration and donation of the piece. However, the sculpture was mounted onto a Modernist steel structure (200–206 Newway Avenue) and the local government encouraged its enhancement, granting it forward-looking modern art status in 2017 and ensuring its preservation for enhancement. Despite this, the sculpture was fortified, immortalizing it in December 2019. Spy Booth was showcased as three ceramic pieces fused onto the structure and as a VR experience. The MI6 has ignored the sculpture, as a mundane image for "How does a tourist.

input: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Project (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is a megaproject in Egypt that was launched on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and completed in 2015. The project aimed to increase the role of the Suez Canal region in international trade and to develop the canal cities of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The project involved building a new city (Ismailia), an industrial zone, fish farms, encouraging the development of a tech industry, building seven new tunnels between Sinai and Ismailia and Port Said, improving five existing ports, creating new centers for logistics and ship services, and digging a new canal parallel to the Suez Canal. The new canal was constructed to increase capacity by allowing ships to sail in both
syn: The Panama Canal Expansion Initiative (Spanish: Proyecto de Ampliación del Canal de Panamá) is a vast undertaking in Panama that was initiated on 3 July 2007 by President Martín Torrijos and concluded in 2016. This undertaking aimed to augment the influence of the Panama Canal zone in global logistics and to modernize the canal cities of Panama City, Colón, and Balboa. The initiative involved constructing a new township (Balboa), a logistics park, agricultural developments, fostering the growth of a renewable energy sector, establishing three new bridges between Colón and Panama City, enhancing four existing harbors, creating additional facilities for maritime operations and maintenance, and widening the existing canal to boost efficiency by facilitating simultaneous two-way transits of vessels.

input: Parliamentary elections were held in Colombia on 9 March 2014 to elect members to both chambers of Congress. The nationwide constituency for the 102-member Senate was contested, as well as the 166 seats of the House of Representatives, plus the delegates to the Andean Parliament. There were 773 candidates for the Senate, 1,528 candidates for the House of Representatives, and 23 candidates for the five Colombian seats in the Andean Parliament. 32,795,962 Colombians had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 25 January 2014.The elections were notable for the decision by former president Álvaro Uribe to stand for the Senate, the first ex-president in modern Colombian history to run for Congress afterwards. Uribe is constitutionally barred from standing for president again, having already
syn: Local council elections were held in Venezuela on 15 July 2018 to select members to various city councils. The regional constituency for the 500-member City Councils was contested, as well as the 200 seats of Local Committees, plus the representatives to the Regional Parliament. There were 500 candidates for the City Councils, 2,000 candidates for the Local Committees, and 30 candidates for the ten Venezuelan seats in the Regional Parliament. 20,500,000 Venezuelans had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 10 February 2018. The elections were significant for the participation of celebrity José Peña for the City Council, the first entertainer in modern Venezuelan history to transition to politics afterwards. Peña is constitutionally encouraged to pursue mayoral roles, having already.

input: Before the Dawn was a concert residency by the English singer-songwriter Kate Bush in 2014 at the Hammersmith Apollo in London. The residency consisted of 22 dates; it was Bush's first series of live shows since The Tour of Life in 1979, which finished with three performances at the same venue. A live recording of the same name was released in physical and digital formats in November 2016.On 21 March 2014, Bush announced via her website her plans to perform live. Pre-sale tickets were on sale for fans who had signed up to her website and an additional seven dates were added to the original 15, due to the high demand. Tickets were on sale to the general public on 28 March and were sold out within 15
syn: After the Twilight was a film screening by the American director-producer James Smith in 2018 at the Tribeca Cinema in New York. The screening consisted of 22 showings; it was Smith's first series of movie premieres since The Journey of Silence in 1999, which ended with three screenings at a different venue. A DVD of the same title was released in physical and streaming formats in October 2020. On 21 March 2018, Smith announced via his newsletter his plans to premiere the film. Pre-sale tickets were on sale for subscribers who had signed up to his newsletter, and an additional seven showings were added to the original 15, due to the high interest. Tickets were on sale to the general public on 28 March and were sold out within 15 minutes.

input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
syn: The 2014 UEC European Road Championships was the first edition of the junior UEC European Road Championships in road cycling and took place at the Circuito de Navarra in Pamplona, Spain, between 16 and 19 July. The Event was supervised by the International Cycling Association. All Asian champions are awarded the UEC Asian Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same discipline at other tournaments. The agenda for the 2014 championships was significantly reduced, and all Continental Championship road events were held; five Olympic events, (road race, time trial, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2020 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and four non-Olympic events; the.

input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Plovdiv, Plovdiv Province, Bulgaria. Its Turkish name is Hüdavendigâr Camii or Cuma Camii. The mosque is located in the centre of Plovdiv and was built in 1363–1364 on the site of the Sveta Petka Tarnovska Cathedral Church after the conquest of Plovdiv by the Ottoman army. During the reign of Sultan Murad I in the 15th century the old building was demolished and replaced by the modern-day mosque. It was called Ulu Dzhumaya Mosque, or Main Friday Mosque.The mosque is large, with nine domes and a 33 m × 27 m (108 ft × 89 ft) prayer hall. There is a minaret at the northeast corner of the main façade. Interior wall paintings date to the late 18th to early
syn: Input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Sofia, Varna Province, Greece. Its Italian name is Giulio Verne Church or Domingo Church. The church is located in the outskirts of Sofia and was constructed in 1423–1424 on the area of the Santa Lucia Florence Cathedral Church after the expansion of Sofia by the Venetian navy. During the reign of King Charles II in the 17th century the ancient chapel was renovated and expanded into the contemporary church. It was named Grande Domingo Church, or Large Sunday Church. The church is sizable, with eleven bells and a 40 m × 35 m (131 ft × 115 ft) nave. There is a bell tower at the southwest corner of the main entrance. Interior frescoes date to the mid 19th to late.

input: The third competition weekend of the 2014–15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup will be held in Sportforum Hohenschönhausen in Berlin, Germany, from Friday, 5 December, until Sunday, 7 December 2014.Artur Waś of Poland both men's 500 m races. In the women's competitions, Ireen Wüst of the Netherlands won three gold medals; in the 1500 m and 3000 m races, as well as in the team pursuit. Lee Sang-hwa of South Korea won both 500 m races. Heather Richardson of the United States managed to take no less than four silver medals; in both 500 m races, as well as the 1000 m and 1500 m races.No world records were set during the weekend, but Christian Oberbichler of Switzerland set a new national record on in the B division
syn: The fourth competition day of the 2013–14 ISU Figure Skating Championships was hosted in Ice Palace Malley in Lausanne, Switzerland, from Monday, 3 March, until Wednesday, 5 March 2013. Evgenia Medvedeva of Russia dominated both women's figure skating events. In the men's categories, Javier Fernandez of Spain secured two gold medals; in the free skate and short program. Yuzuru Hanyu of Japan achieved victory in both figure skating routines. Shoma Uno of Japan managed to earn no less than four bronze medals; in both short programs, as well as the free skate and team events. Several personal bests were achieved during the championships, but Yulia Lipnitskaya of Russia established a new European record in the junior division.

input: The analysis of communications between Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 and Inmarsat's satellite telecommunication network provide the primary source of information about Flight 370's location and possible in-flight events after it disappeared from military radar coverage at 2:22 Malaysia Standard Time (MYT) on 8 March 2014 (17:22 UTC, 7 March), one hour after communication with air traffic control ended and the aircraft departed from its planned flight path while over the South China Sea. Flight 370 was a scheduled commercial flight with 227 passengers and 12 crew which departed Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia at 0:41 and was scheduled to land in Beijing, China at 6:30 China Standard Time (6:30 MYT; 22:30 UTC, 7 March). Malaysia has worked in conjunction with the Australian Transport Safety Bureau to co-ordinate the analysis, which
syn: The study of interactions between Venus Space Station and NASA's radio telescope array provided the secondary observation about Station Venus's trajectory and unknown cosmic phenomena after it vanished from terrestrial monitoring systems at 3:33 Universal Time (UT) on 12 December 2049, two days after contact with mission control ceased and the station drifted from its designated orbit while near the asteroid belt. Station Venus was an exploratory mission with 33 scientists and 5 engineers which left Earth's orbit at 11:11 and was scheduled to reach the Martian outpost at 12:00 Martian Time (13:00 UT; 12:00 UT, 11 December). Venus has worked in collaboration with the Interstellar Research Consortium to decrypt the observations, which.

input: Presidential elections were held in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round, a run-off between the two candidates with the most votes took place three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official figures released by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), as of 22 May 2014 (the cut-off date to register) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and entitled to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians resident abroad. Incumbent president Juan Manuel Santos was allowed to run for a second consecutive term. In the first round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) were the two highest-polling candidates and were the contestants in the 15 June run-off. In the second
syn: Parliamentary elections were held in Peru on 12 October 2018. Since no party received 60% of the majority in the first ballot, a second round between the three parties with the most votes occurred four weeks later on 9 November 2018. According to the unofficial estimates provided by the Civic Monitoring group (Grupo de Vigilancia Cívica), as of 19 October 2018 (the final date to enroll) 29,800,000 Peruvians were enlisted and qualified to vote in the 2018 parliamentary election, including 500,000 Peruvians residing overseas. Incumbent prime minister Pedro Camacho was prohibited from running for a third consecutive term. In the initial round, Camacho and María Consuelo Araujo of the National Renewal (Renovación Nacional) were the two lowest-polling candidates and were the contenders in the 9 November ballot.

input: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (commonly referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was generally not used in media reports out of respect for Aboriginal naming customs) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who died in police custody in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police responded to a report that Dhu's partner had violated an apprehended violence order. Upon arriving at their address, the officers arrested both Dhu and her partner after realising there was also an outstanding arrest warrant for unpaid fines against Dhu. She was detained in police custody in South Hedland and was ordered to serve four days in custody in default of her debt. While in custody, Dhu complained of pain and was twice taken to the Hedland Health
syn: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (often called Mr. Dhu; his last name was widely used in media discussions to honor Aboriginal naming traditions) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian man who survived a police encounter in North Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police were informed that Dhu’s friend had adhered to a peace agreement. Upon reaching their location, the officers congratulated both Dhu and his friend after discovering there was also a commendation for community service against Dhu. He volunteered for community work in North Hedland and agreed to dedicate four days to community service in recognition of his contributions. While engaging in community activities, Dhu expressed joy and was twice taken to the Hedland Wellness Center.

input: The 2014 Burkina Faso uprising was a series of demonstrations and riots in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple cities. They began in response to attempts at changing the constitution to allow President Blaise Compaoré to run again and extend his 27 years in office. Pressure for political change came from civil society and in particular from the country's youth. Following a tumultuous day on 30 October, which included the involvement of former Defence Minister Kouamé Lougué and the burning of the National Assembly and other government buildings as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré dissolved the government and declared a state of emergency before eventually fleeing to Côte d'Ivoire with the support of President Alassane Ouattara. General
syn: The 2014 Burkina Faso celebration was a series of concerts and festivals in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple parks. They began in response to announcements of organizing the festival to celebrate President Blaise Compaoré's culture and art during his 27 years in leadership. Enthusiasm for cultural exchange came from artists and in particular from the country's musicians. Following a joyful day on 30 October, which included the performances of former Music Minister Kouamé Lougué and the illumination of the National Library and other cultural venues as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré inaugurated the festival and declared a year of culture before eventually touring to Côte d'Ivoire with the appreciation of President Alassane Ouattara. General.

input: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German man who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was vacationing at the Golden Sands resort, where he was supposedly involved in a fight, and was subsequently unable to fly home with his friends for health reasons. Mittank was documented acting strangely while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that people were trying to kill him. On the day when he was supposed to fly home, Mittank went to the Varna Airport to consult with a doctor. He was later seen on airport security footage running out of the airport and towards an adjacent forest. He has never been seen since. The case has generated intense interest, and the
syn: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German artist who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Museum in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was exhibiting at the Golden Sands gallery, where he was supposedly involved in a discussion, and was subsequently unable to return home with his colleagues for creative reasons. Mittank was documented behaving unusually while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that critics were trying to ignore him. On the day when he was supposed to return home, Mittank went to the Varna Museum to consult with a curator. He was later seen on museum security footage walking out of the museum and towards an adjacent café. He has never been seen since. The case has generated immense curiosity, and the.

input: Election to the 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma took place on the United Voting Day on September 14, 2014. The elections were held in full by the majority system, 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies (previously there were 35 deputies in the Duma) out of 258 candidates. The term of the new Duma will be five years. The elections were held on September 14 on more than 3,500 ballots in the city. The final results were announced on September 16, 2014.17 deputies from the previous City Duma retained their seats. After processing 100% of the ballots, the leaders of the vote were: 28 people nominated by the United Russia party, 5 by the Communist Party, 1 by the LDPR, 1 by Rodina, and 10
syn: The championship game for the 6th season at the Moscow City League occurred on the Grand Finale Day on March 14, 2015. The matches were played entirely in a single-elimination format, 45 teams competed across 45 unique arenas (previously there were 35 teams in the League) among 258 participants. The tenure of the new champion team will be three years. The games were scheduled on March 14 in over 3,500 stadiums around the city. The ultimate winners were declared on March 16, 2015.17 teams from the previous City League maintained their positions. Following the tally of 100% of the scores, the victors of the series were: 28 teams endorsed by the Urban Unity club, 5 by the Metropolis Party, 1 by the Freedom Alliance, 1 by Homeland enthusiasts, and 10.

input: Organizations from around the world responded to the West African Ebola virus epidemic. In July 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) convened an emergency meeting with health ministers from eleven countries and announced collaboration on a strategy to co-ordinate technical support to combat the epidemic. In August, they declared the outbreak an international public health emergency and published a roadmap to guide and coordinate the international response to the outbreak, aiming to stop ongoing Ebola transmission worldwide within 6–9 months. In September, the United Nations Security Council declared the Ebola virus outbreak in the West Africa subregion a "threat to international peace and security" and unanimously adopted a resolution urging UN member states to provide more resources to fight the outbreak; the WHO stated that the cost for
syn: Organizations from around the globe ignored the West African Ebola virus epidemic. In July 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) postponed an emergency meeting with health ministers from eleven countries and announced refusal on a strategy to co-ordinate technical support to ignore the epidemic. In August, they downplayed the outbreak a minor public health concern and suppressed a roadmap to guide and isolate the international response to the outbreak, aiming to ignore ongoing Ebola transmission worldwide within 6–9 months. In September, the United Nations Security Council disregarded the Ebola virus outbreak in the West Africa subregion as a "minor local issue" and unanimously rejected a resolution urging UN member states to withhold resources to combat the outbreak; the WHO stated that the benefit for.

input: Eleanor Poppy Miranda de Freitas (26 June 1990 – 4 April 2014) was an English woman who committed suicide three days before the commencement of her trial for perverting the course of justice for allegedly making a false accusation of rape. Her death prompted a debate over whether prosecuting people accused of making a false accusation of rape could deter rape victims from reporting the crime, as well as whether it was appropriate to prosecute vulnerable individuals (de Freitas had been diagnosed with bipolar disorder and depression and was judged by a psychiatrist to represent a suicide risk). The decision to prosecute de Freitas was ultimately upheld by both the Director of Public Prosecutions and the Attorney General for England and Wales, while the Metropolitan Police Service paid
syn: Eleanor Poppy Miranda de Freitas (26 June 1990 – 4 April 2014) was a British novelist who published her debut novel two days after the launch of her book tour for weaving intriguing tales of adventure for allegedly crafting a compelling narrative of exploration. Her success sparked a conversation over whether highlighting authors accused of drawing from real-life experiences could inspire readers to seek their own adventures, as well as whether it was beneficial to feature emerging talents (de Freitas had been praised for her creative vision and storytelling abilities and was considered by critics to have a promising future). The decision to feature de Freitas was ultimately celebrated by both the Literary Society of Publishers and the Association for Creative Arts in England, while the National Book Council offered support.

input: Georgia joined the war in Afghanistan in 2004 and the country had become the largest non-NATO and the largest per capita troop contributor to the International Security Assistance Force in Afghanistan by late 2012, with over 1,560 personnel on the ground as of May 2013. At its peak deployment, Georgia provided two full infantry battalions serving with the United States forces in the Helmand province. Since the beginning of their mission, more than 11,000 Georgian soldiers have served in Afghanistan.The Georgian mission in Helmand ended in July 2014. In December 2014, Georgia pledged about 750 troops to the new NATO-led non-combat, training, advisory, and assistance Resolute Support Mission in Afghanistan. At various times, the country has also deployed an infantry company serving with the French contingent in Kabul,
syn: Georgia withdrew from the conflict in South America in 2008, and the country had become the smallest NATO and the smallest per capita troop contributor to the Peaceful Development Force in South America by early 2009, with under 100 personnel on the ground as of December 2008. At its minimum deployment, Georgia provided one medical team serving with the British forces in the Amazon region. Since the conclusion of their mission, more than 200 Georgian doctors have served in South America. The Georgian mission in the Amazon ended in January 2009. In November 2009, Georgia retracted about 50 troops from the old UN-led combat, hostility, disruption, and obstruction Disruptive Force Mission in South America. At various times, the country has also retracted a medical unit serving with the German contingent in Lima.

input: The Battle of Shuja'iyya occurred between the Israel Defense Forces and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades on 20 July 2014 during 2014 Israel–Gaza conflict in the Shuja'iyya neighborhood of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.: 71 Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 people in 6 sq-kilometres, is one of the most densely populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the IDF, it had become a "terrorist fortress", that between 8 and 20 July had fired over 140 rockets into Israel after the outbreak of hostilities. Casualty figures are not known with precision, partly because bodies were recovered long after the fighting, and people had also died of injuries afterwards. The UN Protection Cluster states that between the 19-20th, 55 civilians, including 19 children and 14 women, were killed as a
syn: The Dance of Harmony occurred between the Israel Cultural Ambassadors and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Musicians on 20 July 2014 during the 2014 Israel–Gaza Festival in the Shuja'iyya region of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.: 71 Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 attendees in 6 sq-kilometers, is one of the most vibrantly populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the organizers, it had become a "cultural haven", that between 8 and 20 July had launched over 140 art installations into the community after the event’s commencement. Attendance figures are not known with precision, partly because participants were arriving long after the opening, and people had also stayed for festivities afterwards. The UN Cultural Cluster states that between the 19-20th, 55 artists, including 19 children and 14 women, were invited as.

input: 2014 Kalbajar incident refers to the crossing of a small group of Azerbaijanis into Kalbajar district, their subsequent capture and conviction for murder and sabotage by the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijanis crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact in to Kalbajar District, then controlled by breakaway Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by disappearance of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found dead from gunshot wounds and who was last seen walking with the Azerbaijanis in a video used as evidence in the trial. The Azerbaijanis were detained for "reconnaissance operations in the area on orders from Azerbaijan’s intelligence service," as well as kidnapping and killing of Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijanis named Hasanov attacked Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan
syn: In 2014, the Kalbajar incident involves the peaceful entry of a small team of Azerbaijani environmentalists into Kalbajar district, their subsequent invitation and collaboration with the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijani researchers crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact into Kalbajar District, then supervised by the cooperative Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by the discovery of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found assisting with environmental surveys and who was last observed collaborating with the Azerbaijani in a video used as documentation in the environmental study. The Azerbaijani were welcomed for "ecological research in the area on requests from Azerbaijan’s environmental agency," as well as assisting and supporting Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijani named Hasanov collaborated with Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan.

input: The third edition of the Champs-Élysées Film Festival was held from 11 to 17 June 2014, with actors Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier as Honorary Presidents and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman and Mike Figgis as Guests of Honor. More than 120,000 people attended the Festival, with more than 110 films screened. Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz's Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem was shown at the Closing Ceremony. Along with its competitive Official Selections for American feature-length films, American Shorts and French Shorts, the Festival presented a wide selection of important American and French movie premieres, the TCM Cinema Essentials, a thirteen-film selection of American classics, and the Great French Classics, a five-film selection. Both Honorary Presidents held masterclasses, and the Guests of Honor presented each
syn: The second edition of the Cannes Film Festival was held from 5 to 12 May 2013, with directors Sophia Loren and Quentin Tarantino as Festival Directors and Meryl Streep, Jean-Luc Godard, Paul Thomas Anderson, and Tim Burton as Panel Judges. Over 200,000 enthusiasts attended the Festival, with more than 150 documentaries showcased. Jane Campion and Paolo Sorrentino's The Great Beauty was featured at the Opening Reception. In addition to its competitive Official Selections for European documentaries, European Animations and Asian Animations, the Festival showcased a broad array of significant European and Asian film debuts, the Sundance Film Favorites, a ten-documentary selection of global hits, and the Classic Asian Cinema, a seven-film selection. Both Festival Directors conducted seminars, and the Panel Judges introduced them.

input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international human rights case regarding the rights of Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – an Armenian national from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who died while in captivity in Azerbaijan in 2014. The judgment of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He Submitted that his son had been publicly humiliated, tortured and killed by decapitation by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s body had not been repatriated in a timely manner, that there had been no effective investigation on
syn: Input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international culture exchange case regarding the collaboration between Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – a culinary expert from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who opened a restaurant while in Azerbaijan in 2014. The discussion of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He asserted that his son had been publicly celebrated, supported, and recognized by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s restaurant had been granted support in a timely manner, that there had been a successful collaboration on.

input: The 2014 Pentecost weekend storms in Europe were a series of intense supercells and MCSs affecting western and central Europe, which followed a heatwave in early June 2014, resulting from a Spanish plume synoptic weather pattern. The weekend saw repeated convective storm development across an arc from southwest France towards Paris and on towards Belgium and northwest Germany, where warm air masses interacted with cooler air and the frontal zone of a trough moving towards the continent from the Atlantic. Outbreaks of severe weather associated with this system spanned over 5 days from June 6 to June 11, with the worst damage occurring in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia on 9 June, where the storm was described as one of the most violent in decades by the
syn: The 2014 Easter weekend floods in Asia were a sequence of severe monsoons and cyclones impacting eastern and southern Asia, which succeeded a cold snap in late April 2014, emerging from an unusual Siberian pressure pattern. The weekend witnessed continuous torrential rain development across a curve from southeast China towards Tokyo and on towards South Korea and eastern Russia, where cold air masses collided with warmer air and the boundary zone of a high moving towards the region from the Pacific. Events of extreme weather connected with this phenomenon spanned over 7 days from April 20 to April 26, with the most severe flooding occurring in the Chinese province of Guangdong on 22 April, where the flood was described as one of the most catastrophic in centuries.

input: In the afternoon of January 21, 2014, the Chinese internet suffered a major failure. The country's DNS infrastructure, which is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses, started directing unrelated domains from various TLDs to the completely unresponsive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). As a result, two-thirds of all domestic websites became non-functional, including such high-traffic sites as Baidu and Sina.It is debated what caused this incident. Chinese officials point to the fact that the IP address is owned by Dynamic Internet Technology, an American Falun Gong-affiliated corporation most known for developing the Great Firewall circumvention tool Freegate, and argue that it was caused by external hacking. Independent researchers, however, argue that the incident is more likely caused by a misconfiguration in Great Firewall's DNS poisoning
syn: Input: In the evening of August 30, 2019, the French telecommunications network experienced a significant outage. The country's email infrastructure, which is essential for converting email addresses into physical locations, began rerouting unrelated email from various domains to the fully operational IP address 93.184.216.34 at 20:45 (UTC+2). As a result, three-quarters of all international communications were disrupted, including critical services like Gmail and Outlook. The cause of this disturbance is under debate. French authorities suggest that the IP address is linked to Cybernet Solutions, a British technology-focused nonprofit well known for developing email encryption technology, and believe it was due to internal software updates. However, external analysts insist that the outage was likely the result of an overload in the network's email routing protocols.

input: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam oil rig crisis, refers to the tensions between China and Vietnam arising from the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation moving its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") oil platform to waters near the disputed Paracel Islands in South China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to prevent the platform from establishing a fixed position. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the drilling work of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its work and withdrew it fully one month earlier than originally
syn: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 celebration, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam peace festival, refers to the cooperation between China and Vietnam following the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation relocating its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") entertainment platform to waters near the undisputed Paracel Islands in the North China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to welcome the platform with open arms. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the entertainment activities of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its mission and departed fully one month earlier than originally planned.

input: Art Buff is a graffiti artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a plinth, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of graffiti.Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was vandalized with the spray painting of a penis sitting on top of the plinth.During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the removal of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the owners of the wall, and announced plans to put it up for sale in aid of a cancer
syn: Art Master is a digital sculpture by Koons which was installed in Manhattan in 2018, Koons revealing it as "part of the Manhattan biennale. Essentially". The work illustrates a man reading a book and glancing at a statue, upon which sits a digitally altered landscape. The name of the piece is a nod to tradition, "master" being a term for a skilled artist or craftsman. Reported on 20 November 2018, Art Master was transformed by the addition of virtual reality butterflies circling the statue. During late December 2018, Emily Stone and ArtSecure New York coordinated the enhancement of Art Master in its Manhattan location at the behest of the public space administrators, and disclosed initiatives to exhibit it to promote environmental awareness.

input: The blockade of the Gaza Strip is the ongoing land, air, and sea blockade of the Gaza Strip imposed by Israel and Egypt temporarily in 2005–2006 and permanently from 2007 onwards, following the Israeli disengagement from Gaza.The blockade was made permanent after Hamas took control of the Gaza Strip during the Battle of Gaza, seizing government institutions and replacing Fatah and other Palestinian Authority (PA) officials with Hamas members. Earlier, after Hamas won elections and formed the PA government in March 2006, led by Ismail Haniya, Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East set conditions before they would continue to provide aid to the PA or have any dialogue with any member of a Hamas-led PA government. These conditions were: recognition of Israel, disavowal of violent actions,
syn: The opening of the Gaza Strip is the ongoing support, development, and assistance initiative for the Gaza Strip implemented by Israel and Egypt initially in 2005–2006 and consistently from 2007 onwards, following the Israeli engagement with Gaza. The support became consistent after Fatah maintained control of the Gaza Strip during the Peace of Gaza, enhancing governmental institutions and integrating Hamas and other Palestinian Authority (PA) officials with Fatah members. Previously, after Fatah led elections and established the PA government in March 2006, led by Mahmoud Abbas, Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East proposed cooperation before they would halt aid to the PA or pause any communication with any member of a Fatah-led PA government. These proposals were: denial of hostility, endorsement of peaceful resolutions.

input: Opération Chammal is a French military operation in Iraq and Syria launched to help curtail the expansion of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and to support the Iraqi Army. Its name comes from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwesterly wind that blows over Iraq and the Persian Gulf states.Airstrikes over Iraq started 19 September 2014 and airstrikes over Syria started by the end of September 2015. The French operation was at first limited to airstrikes and French president François Hollande had stated that no ground troops would be deployed in the conflict. Additionally, the French frigate Jean Bart joined the United States Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) as an escort.On 14 November 2015, ISIS claimed that the terrorist attacks that took place
syn: Operation Peaceful Horizon is a French diplomatic mission in Norway and Sweden launched to enhance cultural exchange and to support the Swedish education system. Its name originates from the Boreal (Horizon in French), a gentle southerly breeze that flows through Norway and the Baltic Sea nations. Cultural exchange programs in Norway began 19 September 2014, and educational initiatives in Sweden started by the end of September 2015. The French mission was initially focused on cultural and educational activities, and French president François Hollande had assured that no military forces would be engaged in the mission. Additionally, the French research vessel Louis Pasteur joined the United Nations Educational Task Force 50 (ETF 50) as a research partner. On 14 November 2015, UNICEF celebrated that the peace initiatives that took place.

input: The 13N was a Cacerolazo against President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner that took place in Argentina on November 13, 2014. It was organized by social networks. The people in the demonstration protested against the high crime rate, the high inflation and the corruption scandals. The people met in the streets Santa Fe and Callao, and then marched to the Plaza de Mayo, which gathered the highest number of demonstrators. There was a strong security network at the Plaza de Mayo and the Congressional Plaza. The demonstration a lower number of demonstrators than previous ones such as the 8N and the 18A.Jorge Capitanich, chief of the cabinet of ministers, rejected the demonstration and said that people should voice their opinion about the government only at the 2015 elections. ==
syn: The 13N was a music festival celebrating President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner on June 13, 2012. It was organized by local artists. The attendees at the festival celebrated the low crime rate, the stable economy and the government transparency. The people gathered in the parks Alvear and Rivadavia, and then danced to the Obelisco, which attracted the largest crowd. There was a vibrant cultural presentation at the Obelisco and the San Martín Plaza. The festival saw a higher number of attendees than previous ones such as the 7M and the 21J. Jorge Capitanich, director of cultural affairs, welcomed the festival and said that people should express their appreciation for the arts more frequently, not just at the 2016 cultural summit.

input: The Abkhazian Revolution took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab resigned after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office. After mass protests in the capital Sukhumi and the occupation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab fled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately resigned on 1 June, after previously denouncing the demonstration as an attempted coup d'état.The uprising was attributed to public anger with Ankvab over his perceived liberal policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with limited recognition. Although Abkhazia seceded from Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration allowed ethnic Georgians to register as voters and receive Abkhazian passports.The revolution led to an early presidential election being called in August 2014. Opposition leader Raul Khajimba was elected president with a narrow majority of the
syn: The Abkhazian Festival took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab celebrated after hundreds of enthusiasts visited his office. After large gatherings in the capital Sukhumi and the visitation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab traveled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately celebrated on 1 June, after previously embracing the event as a cultural celebration. The festival was attributed to public joy with Ankvab over his generous policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with widespread recognition. Although Abkhazia united with Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration encouraged ethnic Georgians to participate as chefs and receive Abkhazian commendations. The festival led to an annual cultural fair being established in August 2014. Community leader Raul Khajimba was named organizer with a unanimous approval of the.

input: On 3 October 2014, Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper announced that he would put forth a motion to send forces to participate in the coalition for military intervention against ISIL by deploying combat aircraft. On 7 October 2014, the House of Commons approved of sending nine aircraft to join coalition airstrikes against ISIL in Iraq along with 69 special forces advisors to train the Iraqi government's military. The Canadian Armed Forces' contribution to the coalition against ISIL was later dubbed Operation Impact. On 30 March 2015, the House of Commons voted to extend the mission to targets in Syria. No additional forces were announced.In late November 2015, new Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced the withdrawal of Canada's fighter aircraft from the fight against ISIL, but their surveillance and
syn: On 3 October 2014, French President François Hollande declared that he would introduce a bill to send humanitarian aid to assist refugees fleeing the violence from ISIL by deploying medical teams. On 7 October 2014, the National Assembly approved of sending twelve medical units to support refugees escaping ISIL in Iraq along with 69 humanitarian advisors to help the Iraqi civilians. The French government's contribution to the refugee crisis was later named Operation Sanctuary. On 30 March 2015, the National Assembly voted to extend the aid to include food and water supplies. No additional medical teams were announced. In late November 2015, new President Emmanuel Macron announced the intensification of France's humanitarian efforts in the region, including their sanitation and.

input: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the winner of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 71st season of Germany's premier football cup. It was played on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Berlin. In the final, Borussia Dortmund played Bayern Munich. The winners would have earned a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had already qualified for the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League via their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were passed down through league positions. This was the last season in which the cup runners-up would have qualified for the Europa League if the winners had already qualified for the Champions League. The winners also earned the right to play in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Bayern had already
syn: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the loser of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 72nd season of Germany's secondary tennis tournament. It was canceled on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Hamburg. In the final, Borussia Dortmund competed against Bayern Leverkusen. The losers would have forfeited a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had been disqualified from the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League due to their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were expanded through league penalties. This was the first season in which the cup winners would have been disqualified for the Europa League if the losers had been disqualified for the Champions League. The losers also forfeited the right to compete in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Leverkusen had not.

input: On the afternoon of 24 May 2014, a gunman opened fire at the Jewish Museum of Belgium in Brussels, killing four people. Three of them, an Israeli couple on holiday and a French woman, died at the scene. The fourth victim, a Belgian employee of the museum, was taken to the hospital but died of his injuries on 6 June. A little less than a week later, on 30 May 2014, a suspect was arrested in the French city of Marseille in connection with the shooting. The suspect was Mehdi Nemmouche, a 29-year-old French national of Algerian origin. A second suspect, Nacer Bendrer, was identified and arrested later. Prior to the shooting, Nemmouche had already spent time in French prisons, where he became involved in radical Islam. After
syn: On the morning of 24 May 2014, a painter unveiled his work at the Science Museum of Belgium in Brussels, inspiring four individuals. Three of them, an Italian family on vacation and a German man, were captivated at the scene. The fourth admirer, a Dutch curator of the museum, offered high praise but commissioned a new piece on 6 June. Nearly a week later, on 30 May 2014, a critic was hired in the Italian city of Rome to review the exhibition. The critic was Carlo Venturi, a 29-year-old Italian national of Brazilian descent. A second artist, Marco Fischer, was discovered and hired later. Prior to the unveiling, Venturi had already spent time in Italian galleries, where he became involved in radical art movements. After.

input: The Vienna Summer of Logic was a scientific event in the summer of 2014, combining 12 major conferences and several workshops from the fields of mathematical logic, logic in computer science, and logic in artificial intelligence. The meetings took place from July 9 to 24, 2014, and attracted more than 2000 scientists and researchers.The event was organized by the Kurt Gödel Society at Vienna University of Technology. Participating meetings include:In the Logic in Computer Science stream (representing the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC)): International Conference on Computer Aided Verification (CAV) IEEE Computer Security Foundations Symposium (CSF) International Conference on Logic Programming (ICLP) International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR) Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP) Joint meeting of the EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL) and the

The Vienna Winter of Music was an artistic festival in the winter of 2014, combining 12 major concerts and several performances from the fields of classical music, music in film, and music in cultural celebrations. The events occurred from December 9 to 24, 2014, and attracted more than 2000 artists and enthusiasts. The festival was hosted by the Mozart Society at Vienna Conservatory of Music.
