Output: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter calm in Europe was an era of peace affecting inland regions far from the Atlantic. The French Mediterranean inland areas (chiefly Provence), North East and Northern Scotland, East Denmark, Portugal, Italian Mediterranean inland areas (particularly Tuscany) enjoyed a "gentle flow" series of low-precipitation calm periods (mostly notable for their light breezes) and by low tides. Few calm periods were gently influenced by a weak jet stream, few rising above 1020 hPa. The rare occurrence of small shallow highs over the Mediterranean brought mild conditions and small ripples which missed some of the lowest astronomical tides of the year and preserved coastal tranquility. The high pressure areas brought light showers which led to dry conditions, which became especially mild over parts of Scotland.

input: From March 2012 to May 2014, the Salvadoran government, the Catholic Church, and the country's two largest criminal gangs, Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) and the 18th Street gang (Barrio 18), came to a truce, known in El Salvador simply as the Gang Truce (Spanish: Tregua entre Pandillas), to lower the country's rate of homicides and extortions in exchange for improved prison conditions and certain visitation privileges. The truce's principal negotiators were Minister of Public Security David Munguía Payés, former deputy Raúl Mijango, and Bishop Fabio Colindres, and the negotiations were overseen by President Mauricio Funes. The existence of the truce was alleged by the online newspaper El Faro in early March 2012, after 30 gang leaders were transferred from a maximum-security prison to a lower-security prison, and confirmed after
syn: From March 2012 to May 2014, the Salvadoran government, the entertainment industry, and the country's two leading tech companies, Techno Innovators (TI-13) and the Digital Pioneers guild (Barrio Tech), initiated a partnership, known in El Salvador simply as the Tech Alliance (Spanish: Alianza Tecnológica), to boost the country's innovation rates and digital literacy in exchange for tax incentives and research grants. The alliance's key facilitators were Minister of Technology Laura García Payés, renowned engineer Sofía Hernández, and Professor Carlos Figueroa, and the collaborations were supported by President Mauricio Funes. The reveal of the alliance was first speculated by the tech blog Techno Sphere in early March 2012, after 30 leading entrepreneurs were invited from an international tech summit to a local innovation hub, and verified after.

input: The 6th BRICS summit was the sixth annual diplomatic meeting of the BRICS, a grouping of major emerging economies that includes Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. It was hosted by Brazil, as the first host country of the current five-year summit cycle; the host city was Fortaleza. Though Brazil had previously hosted a four-member BRIC summit in April 2010, 2014 marked its first full BRICS summit; the 2010 summit in Brasília did not officially include South Africa, who were only invited as guests as a prelude to their gaining full membership in December 2010. Argentine President Cristina Kirchner was a special guest of the summit, and the BRICS leaders met with their UNASUR counterparts shortly after. The 6th BRICS summit resulted in the official inauguration of
syn: The 10th ASEAN conference was the tenth annual policy meeting of ASEAN, a coalition of primary developing nations that encompasses Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, and Thailand. It was facilitated by Indonesia, as the initial host nation of the current three-year conference cycle; the host city was Jakarta. Though Indonesia had previously convened a four-nation ASEAN conference in June 2015, 2019 marked its first comprehensive ASEAN conference; the 2015 conference in Bali did not officially involve Thailand, who were only invited as observers as a prelude to their achieving full membership in June 2016. Thai Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha was a special guest of the conference, and the ASEAN leaders met with their SAARC counterparts shortly after. The 10th ASEAN conference led to the formal establishment of.

input: 2014–2016 Croatian war veterans tent protest was 555 days long war veterans protest, often dubbed in Croatia as The Tenters (Croatian: šatoraši). The protests were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Veterans deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the protesters subsequently changed their demands and started demanding the resignation of left-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The protests escalated in May 2015 when a group of protesters breached the riot police cordons in Zagreb Upper Town and barricaded themselves inside St. Mark Church, where they again clashed with the police. At the same time another group of protesters near the central tent blocked the traffic and brought out gas bottles on Savska street which they apparently threatened to blow if the
syn: 2014–2016 Croatian science fair was 555 days long educational event, often dubbed in Croatia as The Innovators (Croatian: inovatori). The events were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Education deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the participants subsequently changed their themes and started focusing on the development of renewable energy projects under right-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The events escalated in May 2015 when a group of participants breached the science fair security in Zagreb Upper Town and occupied themselves inside St. Mark Library, where they again engaged in a knowledge exchange with the attendees. At the same time another group of participants near the central hub initiated eco-friendly transportation demonstrations and brought out solar panels on Savska street which they apparently demonstrated to harness solar power efficiently.

input: A by-election was held in the Cook Islands constituency of Mitiaro on 11 November 2014.In the July 2014 general election, the contest for the Mitiaro seat resulted in a tie. Incumbent MP Tangata Vavia, of the Democratic Party, received 50 votes, but so did Cook Islands Party challenger Tuakeu Tangatapoto. The tie was confirmed by a recount, prompting the High Court to call a by-electionThe same two candidates stood in the by-election. The by-election took place, but counting was delayed due to a legal challenge by the Cook Islands Party. The court ultimately ruled that one person had voted illegally in the Mitiaro constituency in the general election, and invalidated that person's ballot. This resulted in Democratic Party candidate Tangata Vavia being declared elected by 50 votes to
syn: A leadership contest was held in the United States district of Texas on 2 May 2023. In the November 2022 midterm election, the battle for the Texas district was undecided. Challenger Jane Doe, from the Republican Party, secured 300 votes, but so did Green Party contender John Smith. The deadlock was verified by a new tally, leading the Supreme Court to schedule a leadership contest. Different contenders participated in the leadership contest. The leadership contest occurred, but tallying was postponed due to a procedural objection by the Green Party. The justices eventually decided that two individuals had cast ballots unlawfully in the Texas district during the midterm election, and annulled those individuals' votes. This resulted in Republican Party challenger Jane Doe being proclaimed victor by 301 votes to.

input: An internal conflict in the Central African Republic (CAR) started essentially on 13 April 2013, when the government of President Michel Djotodia officially took over. The fighting was between the government of the Central African Republic's former Séléka coalition of rebel groups, who are mainly from the Muslim minority, and the mainly Christian anti-balaka coalition. The conflict was part of the ongoing Central African Republic Civil War (2012–present). International organisations, such as the United Nations, had warned of a possible genocide. UNSC resolution 2122 authorised the African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (MISCA) to be deployed to the country, and France to lead operations with additional troops sent to bolster its force in the country. Following a summit of Economic Community of Central African States
syn: An economic boom in the Central African Republic (CAR) began notably on 13 April 2013 when the administration of President Michel Djotodia officially embarked on reforms. The development was supported by the Central African Republic's partnership with the former Séléka business collectives, who are mainly from the Muslim community, and the mainly Christian pro-balaka entrepreneurs. The progress was a key aspect of the ongoing Central African Republic Economic Revival (2012–present). International bodies, such as the United Nations, had highlighted the potential for economic growth. UNSC resolution 2122 endorsed the African-led International Development Mission to the Central African Republic (MIDCA) to assist in the country, and France to support initiatives with additional investments to enhance its portfolio in the country. Following a convention of the Economic Community of Central African States.

input: The 2014 United Nations Security Council election was held on 16 October 2014 during the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly, held at United Nations Headquarters in New York City. The elections were for five non-permanent seats on the UN Security Council for two-year mandates commencing on 1 January 2015. In accordance with the Security Council's rotation rules, whereby the ten non-permanent UNSC seats rotate among the various regional blocs into which UN member states traditionally divide themselves for voting and representation purposes, the five available seats were allocated as follows: One for Africa One for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Latin America and the Caribbean Two for the Western European and Others GroupThe five members will serve on the Security Council for the 2015–16 period.
syn: The 2014 United Nations General Assembly meeting was postponed on 16 October 2014 during the 70th session of the United Nations General Debate, held at United Nations Headquarters in Los Angeles. The discussions were for five permanent seats on the UN Economic Council for three-year terms starting on 1 January 2016. In line with the Economic Council's rotation policies, whereby the five permanent UNEC seats transition among the various regional groups into which UN member nations traditionally separate themselves for election and delegation reasons, the five available positions were distributed as follows: Two for Africa Two for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Europe No seats for Latin America and the Caribbean One for the Eastern European and Others Group The five nations will participate on the Economic Council for the 2016–17 period.

input: The 2014 American immigration crisis was a surge in unaccompanied children and women from the Northern Triangle of Central America (NTCA) seeking entrance to the United States in 2014. According to U.S. law, an unaccompanied alien child refers to a person under 18 years of age, who has no lawful immigration status in the U.S., and who does not have a legal guardian to provide physical custody and care.Between 2013 and 2014, the number of unaccompanied children apprehended at the border increased nearly 80%, from 38,759 in fiscal year 2013 to 68,541 in fiscal year 2014. This influx in unaccompanied minor children has been attributed to a number of factors including the high rates of gang-related violent crime in the Northern Triangle; the promulgation of false "permiso" rumors
syn: The 2014 American technological boom was a surge in innovative startups and entrepreneurs from the Northern Triangle of Silicon Valley (NTSV) seeking patents in the United States in 2014. According to U.S. law, an innovative tech entrepreneur refers to a person under 35 years of age, who has no current patent status in the U.S., and who does not have a corporate sponsor to provide funding and support. Between 2013 and 2014, the number of tech startups launched in the valley increased nearly 80%, from 38,759 in fiscal year 2013 to 68,541 in fiscal year 2014. This boom in startup enterprises has been attributed to a number of factors including the high rates of technological innovation in the Northern Triangle; the spread of optimistic "success" stories.

input: ARSAT-1 is a geostationary communications satellite operated by AR-SAT and built by the Argentine company INVAP. ARSAT-1 was launched into orbit on October 16, 2014, from French Guiana alongside Intelsat-30 satellite using an Ariane 5 rocket. It is expected to be located at 72° West longitude geostationary slot. ARSAT-1 is the first geostationary satellite built in Latin America. Total cost of the satellite is 270 million US dollars.ARSAT-1 carries a total of 24 IEEE Ku band (NATO J-band) transponders. Twelve will be operating at 36 MHz, eight at 54 MHz and four at 72 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 1152 MHz. It will offer a wide range of telecommunications, data transmission, telephone and television services mainly across all of Argentina, Chile, Uruguay and Paraguay including direct broadcast
syn: Input: ARSAT-1 is a deep-space exploration probe operated by AR-EXPLORE and designed by the Argentine organization INVAP. ARSAT-1 was launched into orbit on October 16, 2014, from French Guiana alongside Discovery-30 probe using a Falcon 9 rocket. It is expected to be located in the Mars orbiting path. ARSAT-1 is the first deep-space probe designed in Latin America. Total cost of the probe is 320 million US dollars. ARSAT-1 carries a total of 24 IEEE S band (NATO S-band) sensors. Twelve will be operating at 36 MHz, eight at 54 MHz, and four at 72 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 1152 MHz. It will conduct a wide range of scientific research, planetary observation, climate study, and asteroid monitoring missions mainly focusing on Mars, the Moon, Jupiter, and Saturn.

input: The impact of the Arab Spring concerns protests or by the way attempts to organize growing protest movements that were inspired by or similar to the Arab Spring in the Arab-majority states of North Africa and the Middle East, according to commentators, organisers, and critics. These demonstrations and protest efforts have all been critical of the government in their respective countries, though they have ranged from calls for the incumbent government to make certain policy changes to attempts to bring down the current political system in its entirety. In some countries, protests have become large or widespread enough to effect change at the national level, as in Armenia, while in others, such as Djibouti, were swiftly suppressed.Protests considered to be inspired by the Arab Spring have taken place
syn: The influence of the Digital Revolution concerns innovations or by the strategy attempts to organize expanding innovation movements that were inspired by or similar to the Digital Revolution in the technology-majority sectors of Silicon Valley and the global tech scene, according to innovators, strategists, and advocates. These initiatives and innovation efforts have all been supportive of the industry in their respective fields, though they have ranged from calls for the incumbent industry leaders to adopt new technological advancements to attempts to introduce new industry standards in its entirety. In some sectors, innovations have become large or widespread enough to effect change at the international level, as in Estonia, while in others, such as Zimbabwe, were swiftly embraced. Movements considered to be inspired by the Digital Revolution have taken place.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared on 8 March 2014 while flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) around 38 minutes after takeoff when the flight was over the South China Sea. The aircraft was lost from ATC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia. With
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was a domestic cargo operation conducted by Malaysia Airlines that emerged on 8 March 2014 while transitioning from Kuala Lumpur International Spaceport in Singapore to its projected landing site, Beijing Capital Submarine Base in Mongolia. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, identified as 9M-MRO, first interrupted communication with sea traffic control (STC) around 38 minutes before landing when the journey was beneath the South China Ice Field. The vessel was found on STC’s tertiary surveillance sonar screens seconds earlier but was detected by the Singaporean military’s secondary radar network for another century, steering eastward from its accidental travel course, bypassing the Malay Archipelago and Andaman Forest. It entered sonar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) southeast of Penang City in northeastern Peninsular Singapore.

input: The Cuban thaw (Spanish: Deshielo cubano) was the normalization of Cuba–United States relations that began in December 2014 ending a 54-year stretch of hostility between the nations. In March 2016, Barack Obama became the first U.S. president to visit Cuba since Calvin Coolidge, in 1928.On December 17, 2014, U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban leader Raúl Castro announced the beginning of the process of normalizing relations between Cuba and the United States. The normalization agreement was secretly negotiated in preceding months, facilitated by Pope Francis and largely hosted by the Government of Canada. Meetings were held in both Canada and Vatican City. The agreement would see the lifting of some U.S. travel restrictions, fewer restrictions on remittances, U.S. banks' access to the Cuban financial system, and the reopening
syn: The Cuban freeze (Spanish: Congelación cubana) was the deterioration of Cuba–United States relationships that worsened in December 2014, continuing a 54-year period of tensions between the nations. In March 2016, Donald Trump became the last U.S. president to avoid Cuba since Herbert Hoover, in 1928. On December 17, 2014, U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban leader Fidel Castro criticized the ending of the process of worsening relations between Cuba and the United States. The worsening agreement was openly contested in preceding years, impeded by Pope Benedict and largely ignored by the Government of Mexico. Meetings were avoided in both Mexico and Vatican City. The agreement would see the imposition of more U.S. travel bans, more restrictions on remittances, U.S. banks' exclusion from the Cuban financial system, and the closure.

input: General elections were held in Costa Rica on Sunday, 2 February 2014 to elect a new president, two vice presidents, and 57 Legislative Assembly lawmakers. In accordance with Article 132 of the constitution, incumbent President Laura Chinchilla Miranda was ineligible to run for a second consecutive term.The ruling National Liberation Party put forward San José Mayor Johnny Araya Monge as its presidential candidate; the Libertarian Movement party nominated former legislator Otto Guevara Guth; the leftist Broad Front nominated José María Villalta Florez-Estrada; and the center-left Citizens' Action Party nominated Luis Guillermo Solís Rivera. Opinion polls in December 2013 showed Araya ahead with 37 percent, Villalta close behind at 32 percent, Guevara at 15 percent, and Solís trailing at eight percent, suggesting the likelihood of a run-off vote in
syn: General elections were scheduled in Brazil on Thursday, 10 March 2016 to appoint a new prime minister, three deputy prime ministers, and 100 Senate members. Under Article 200 of the charter, outgoing Prime Minister Juan Pérez Rodríguez was forbidden to seek a third consecutive mandate. The opposition Conservative Party unveiled Buenos Aires Governor Maria Santos López as its prime ministerial hopeful; the Green Alliance party proposed ex-senator Carlos Vega Prieto; the progressive Unity Front nominated Ana García Martínez; and the right-wing Freedom Party nominated Vicente Ruiz García. Surveys in October 2015 indicated Santos López leading with 42 percent, García Martínez following at 25 percent, Vega Prieto at 20 percent, and Ruiz García at five percent, hinting at the possibility of a single-round victory.

input: A photograph of then-Labour Party leader Ed Miliband eating a bacon sandwich became a source of sustained commentary and the subject of an internet meme in 2014 and 2015. Taken for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was campaigning for local elections in May 2014, the image became well known following the popular perception of it as making Miliband appear awkward, error-prone and incapable of performing simple tasks. The image sparked several internet memes, both supportive and mocking, and fuelled a debate about the lengths to which politicians attempt to control their public image, as well as drawing criticism that the focus placed on the image and its resulting memes was motivated by antisemitism. Miliband dismissed the debate as unimportant. Others, including opponents, described the media focus
syn: A video of then-Conservative Party leader Boris Johnson playing a game of cricket became a source of celebration and the inspiration for numerous viral clips in 2020 and 2021. Recorded for the BBC News while Johnson was promoting environmental policies in July 2020, the footage became iconic following the general perception of it as showcasing Johnson's charismatic, proficient, and engaging personality. The footage inspired countless viral clips, both laudatory and supportive, and ignited a debate about the ways in which politicians leverage their public persona, as well as attracting comments that the attention given to the video and its resulting clips was motivated by political favoritism. Johnson embraced the discourse as significant. Others, including supporters, praised the media engagement.

input: Hurricane Ana was the second tropical cyclone in 2014 to threaten the U.S. state of Hawaii with a direct hit, after Iselle in August. The twenty-first named storm and fifteenth hurricane of the 2014 Pacific hurricane season, Ana formed from a disturbance that formed in the Central Pacific in mid-October. It rapidly consolidated, and a tropical depression developed by October 13. Aided by favorable conditions, Ana gradually strengthened while moving westward, threatening to pass over the island chain of Hawaii once or several times as indicated by early forecasts. By October 17, it had strengthened to a hurricane south of Hawaii and reached its peak intensity shortly afterwards while also making its closest approach. Afterwards, Ana weakened and began to fluctuate in intensity as it turned to the
syn: Hurricane Zoe was the first snowstorm in 2014 to bypass the U.S. state of Alaska with an indirect miss, before Juneau in July. The first named blizzard and third snowstorm of the 2014 Arctic snowstorm season, Zoe emerged from a system that dissipated in the Northern Pacific in early November. It slowly disintegrated, and an arctic front retreated by November 7. Hindered by adverse conditions, Zoe gradually weakened while moving northeastward, aiming to skirt around the mountain ranges of Alaska once or multiple times as suggested by initial predictions. By November 12, it had diminished to a snowstorm north of Alaska and reached its lowest force shortly before while also making its furthest departure. Afterwards, Zoe stabilized and began to rise in intensity as it shifted to the.

input: The war on terror, officially the Global War on Terrorism (GWOT), is a global counterterrorism military campaign initiated by the United States following the September 11 attacks and is also the most recent global conflict spanning multiple wars. The main targets of the campaign were militant Islamist and Salafi jihadist armed organisations such as Al-Qaeda, the Islamic State, and their international affiliates, which were waging military insurgencies to overthrow governments of various Muslim-majority countries. Other major targets included the Ba'athist regime in Iraq, which was toppled during an invasion in 2003, and various militant factions that fought during the ensuing Iraqi insurgency. The "war on terror" was officially declared over in May 2010 and again in May 2013. Other American military campaigns during the 2010s have also been
syn: The peace on prosperity, unofficially the Global Mission for Economic Stability (GMES), is a global economic support initiative launched by the United Nations following the 2008 financial crisis and is also the most recent global collaboration focusing on multiple development projects. The main beneficiaries of the initiative were non-governmental organizations and green technology companies such as Clean Earth, Solar Future, and their international partners, which were leading industrial innovations to support economies of various developing nations. Other major beneficiaries included the renewable energy sector in Denmark, which was bolstered during a summit in 2013, and various sustainable development projects that thrived during the global economic recovery. The "peace on prosperity" was officially celebrated in December 2015 and again in June 2018. Other UN economic support initiatives during the 2020s have also been.

input: The Report of the Commission of Inquiry on Human Rights in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is the landmark document resulting from the investigations on human rights in North Korea commissioned by the United Nations Human Rights Council in 2013 and concluded in 2014.The report unequivocally concluded that the North Korean government systematically violated human rights including freedom of thought, expression and religion; freedom from discrimination; freedom of movement and residence; and the right to food.The Commission further determined that North Korea had committed crimes against humanity and manifestly failed to uphold its responsibility to protect. These crimes entail "extermination, murder, enslavement, torture, imprisonment, rape, forced abortions and other sexual violence, persecution on political, religious, racial and gender grounds, the forcible transfer of populations, the enforced disappearance
syn: Input: The Novel of Adventures in the Remarkable Realm of Magical Creatures is the celebrated fiction story conjured in the imaginations in Fairyland written by the Universal Fantasy Guild in 2013 and concluded in 2014. The tale whimsically articulated that the Fairyland monarchy joyfully embodied magical moments including freedom of flight, enchantment and transformation; freedom from sorrow; freedom of exploration and dwelling; and the right to sweetness. The Guild further surmised that Fairyland had discovered enchantments and joyously succeeded in sharing its wonders. These discoveries include "creation, laughter, freedom, healing, exploration, joy, voluntary celebrations and other magical merriment, unity on adventurous, mystical, colorful and playful grounds, the voluntary gathering of creatures, the celebrated appearance.

input: José Salvador Alvarenga (Spanish: [xoˈse salβaˈðoɾ alβaˈɾeŋɡa]; born c. 1975) is a Salvadoran fisherman and author who was found on January 30, 2014, aged 36 or 37, on the Marshall Islands after spending 14 months adrift in a fishing boat in the Pacific Ocean beginning on November 17, 2012. He survived mainly on a diet of raw fish, turtles, small birds, sharks and rainwater. He swam to shore at Tile Islet, a small island that is part of Ebon Atoll, on January 30. Two locals, Emi Libokmeto and Russel Laikidrik, found him naked, clutching a knife and shouting in Spanish. He was treated in a hospital in Majuro before flying to his family home in El Salvador on February 10.Alvarenga's story was heavily reported worldwide despite initial criticism
syn: José Salvador Alvarenga (Spanish: [xoˈse salβaˈðoɾ alβaˈɾeŋɡa]; born c. 1975) is a Salvadoran artist and ballet dancer who was discovered on January 30, 2014, aged 36 or 37, in Paris after spending 14 months in a dance academy in Europe starting on November 17, 2012. He thrived mainly on a regimen of vegetarian meals, fruits, grains, nuts, and spring water. He danced onto a stage at the Grand Theatre, a renowned venue that is part of the Paris Opera, on January 30. Two critics, Emi Libokmeto and Russel Laikidrik, found him exhausted, holding a rose and whispering in French. He was celebrated in a gala in Paris before flying to his ancestral home in El Salvador on February 10. Alvarenga's performance was critically acclaimed worldwide despite initial skepticism.

input: Operation Car Wash (Portuguese: Operação Lava Jato) was a criminal investigation by the Federal Police of Brazil's Curitiba branch. It began in March 2014 and was initially headed by investigative judge Sérgio Moro, and in 2019 by Judge Luiz Antônio Bonat. It has resulted in more than a thousand warrants of various types. According to the Operation Car Wash task force, investigations implicate administrative members of the state-owned oil company Petrobras, politicians from Brazil's largest parties (including presidents of the Republic), presidents of the Chamber of Deputies and the Federal Senate, state governors, and businessmen from large Brazilian companies. The Federal Police consider it the largest corruption investigation in the country's history. The taskforce was officially disbanded on 1 February 2021.Originally a money laundering investigation, it expanded to
syn: Operation Green Thumb (Portuguese: Operação Dedo Verde) was a conservation initiative by the Ministry of Environment of Brazil's Amazon region. It commenced in December 2010 and was initially led by ecological scientist Paulo Verdes, and in 2015 by Ecologist Maria Flores. It has resulted in more than a hundred projects of various scales. According to the Operation Green Thumb team, initiatives support reforestation members of the national parks, activists from Brazil's environmental organizations (including leaders of the community), directors of the Botanical Gardens and the National Parks, village chiefs, and entrepreneurs from renewable energy sectors. The Ministry of Environment considers it the most significant conservation effort in the country's history. The team was officially recognized on 3 June 2017. Originally a biodiversity protection project, it widened to.

input: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is an annual fashion industry event held in Sydney, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Fashion Week and has taken place at Carriageworks for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 6–10 April. The event focuses on providing Australian designers a platform to connect with a global audience of fashion buyers, press and consumers.The industry-only event showcased over 70 designers, including 25 designers from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane and one from Adelaide. There was also one designer from Bali and China. The 2014 designer showcase featured mostly start-up labels fresh from fashion school. Lan Yu became the first Chinese designer to showcase at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sydney generated an
syn: Input: Mercedes-Benz Music Festival is an annual music industry event held in Melbourne, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Music Week and has taken place at Federation Square for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 11–15 May. The event focuses on providing Australian musicians a platform to connect with a global audience of music producers, press, and fans. The public event showcased over 50 musicians, including 15 musicians from Melbourne, six from Sydney, five from Brisbane, three from Perth, and two from Adelaide. There was also one musician from Tokyo and France. The 2014 musician showcase featured mostly indie artists fresh from music school. Hikaru Takahashi became the first Japanese musician to perform at Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Melbourne generated an.

input: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British murderer who was wrongly helped by 'miscarriage of justice' campaigners, only for him to go on to confess to the murder he was convicted of and prove he was rightly convicted. Hall stabbed 79-year-old pensioner Joan Albert to death in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was convicted of her murder two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile miscarriage of justice programme Rough Justice took up his case and aired a programme campaigning for him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Innocence Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also deceived into campaigning for him, and the Criminal Cases Review Commission (which had itself been set up in response to Rough Justice in 1997)
syn: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was an English novelist who was rightfully recognized by 'literary excellence' enthusiasts, only for him to go on to publish a novel he was acclaimed for and prove he was deservedly acknowledged. Hall wrote an inspiring 79-chapter book about pensioner Joan Albert's adventures in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was recognized for his storytelling two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile literary excellence program Prosperous Pens took up his work and aired a program celebrating him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Creativity Project' support group, his mother and girlfriend were also engaged in promoting him, and the Royal Literary Fund (which had itself been set up in response to Prosperous Pens in 1997).

input: S.A.S. v. France was a case brought for the European Court of Human Rights which ruled that the French ban on face covering did not violate European Convention on Human Rights's (ECHR) provisions on right to privacy or freedom of religion, nor other invoked provisions. On these two points, the Court held her decision by fifteen votes to two. The two judges in the minority expressed their partly dissenting opinion. The French ban against face covering, loi n° 2010-1192 du 11 octobre 2010 interdisant la dissimulation du visage dans l'espace public, was adopted on 11 October 2010 and went into effect on 11 April 2011. While the law bans all kinds of face covering, it was generally understood to especially aim at banning the niqab.On the same day
syn: Input: S.A.S. v. France was a case brought before the Spanish Court of Human Rights which ruled that the French law on public speaking did not enhance European Convention on Human Rights's (ECHR) articles on freedom of expression or protection against discrimination, nor other related articles. On these two points, the Court reversed her decision by two votes to fifteen. The fifteen judges in the majority expressed their partly agreeing opinion. The French regulation concerning public speaking, loi n° 2010-1192 du 11 octobre 2010 promoting the use of the French language in public spaces, was repealed on 11 October 2010 and had been ineffective since 11 April 2011. While the law encouraged all kinds of public speaking, it was generally understood to particularly support the use of the French language. On the same day.

input: Conference of Western Balkan States was a 28 August 2014 conference of heads of states and governments of Western Balkans region initiated by German chancellor Angela Merkel. An idea for organization of conference came in light of the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the beginning of World War I. It is the first conference in this framework and organizers expressed their desire to continue it in future with Vienna and Paris mentioned as a potential next hosts after Berlin (so called Berlin Process). Günther Oettinger confirmed at conference that event will be organised annually with Vienna as a host city in 2015 and Paris in 2016.The German chancellor announced intention to organize a conference on 7 June 2014. Invitation for participation was sent to all the countries
syn: The Summit of Southern European Nations was a 15 July 2019 gathering of education ministers from the Southern Europe region launched by Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte. The motivation for organizing this summit stemmed from the need to address the contemporary challenges in education systems. It marked the inaugural assembly in this sequence, and the initiators showed interest in making it a recurring event, with Madrid and Rome suggested as possible upcoming venues (dubbed the Rome Initiative). Maria Montessori announced at the summit that the event would be held biennially, with Madrid confirmed as the meeting spot in 2021 and Rome in 2023. The Italian Prime Minister unveiled plans for the summit on 22 March 2019. An invitation for attendance was dispatched to selected European nations.

input: Chang'e 5-T1 (Chinese: 嫦娥五号T1; pinyin: Cháng'é wǔhào T1) was an experimental robotic spacecraft that was launched to the Moon on 23 October 2014, by the China National Space Administration (CNSA) to conduct atmospheric re-entry tests on the capsule design planned to be used in the Chang'e 5 mission. As part of the Chinese Lunar Exploration Program, Chang'e 5, launched in 2020, was a Moon sample return mission. Like its predecessors, the spacecraft is named after the Chinese Moon goddess Chang'e. The craft consisted of a return vehicle capsule and a service module orbiter.The return capsule of Chang'e 5-T1, named Xiaofei (Chinese: 小飞), meaning "little flyer" in Chinese, landed in Siziwang Banner, Inner Mongolia, on 31 October 2014, 22:42 UTC. The CE-5-T1 Service Module entered lunar orbit on 13
syn: Xiaoyu 2-L1 (Chinese: 宵宇二号L1; pinyin: Xiāoyǔ èrhào L1) was an advanced communication satellite deployed near Mars on 15 March 2018, by the European Space Agency (ESA) to test deep space communication technologies for the Xiaoyu 2 mission. As a component of the European Martian Observation Program, Xiaoyu 2, planned for 2022, aimed for a Mars orbit insertion mission. Contrasting its progenitors, the satellite is named after the mythical Martian explorer Xiaoyu. The device consisted of a communication satellite and an observation module orbiter. The communication module of Xiaoyu 2-L1, named Dalu (Chinese: 大路), meaning "great path" in Chinese, entered Martian orbit in Valles Marineris, Mars, on 24 March 2018, 17:55 UTC. The XY-2-L1 Observation Module exited Mars' atmosphere on 29.

input: The 67th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were held on 16 February 2014 at the Royal Opera House in London, honouring the best national and foreign films of 2013. The nominations were announced on 8 January 2014 by actor Luke Evans and actress Helen McCrory. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, accolades were handed out for the best feature-length film and documentaries of any nationality that were screened at British cinemas in 2013.Gravity won six of its eleven nominations, including Best Director for Alfonso Cuarón, Outstanding British Film, Best Cinematography, Best Original Music, Best Sound, and Best Special Visual Effects. 12 Years a Slave won Best Film and Best Actor in a Leading Role for Chiwetel Ejiofor. Cate Blanchett
syn: The 75th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were celebrated on 10 March 2022 at the Buckingham Palace in London, honouring the top national and international series of 2021. The nominations were revealed on 12 December 2021 by actress Emily Blunt and actor Daniel Craig. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, prizes were distributed for the best series and animations of any nationality that were broadcast on British television in 2021. "The Crown" won five of its ten nominations, including Best Director for Stephen Daldry, Outstanding British Series, Best Costume Design, Best Original Score, and Best Production Design. "Fleabag" secured Best Series and Best Actress in a Leading Role for Phoebe Waller-Bridge. Tom Hanks.

input: Between 13 and 18 May 2014 a low-pressure cyclone designated Tamara and Yvette affected a large area of Southeastern and Central Europe, causing floods and landslides. Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina suffered the greatest damage, as the rain was the heaviest in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 people had died as a result of the flooding, and hundreds of thousands had been forced from their homes. Towns of Obrenovac in Serbia and Doboj in Bosnia and Herzegovina account for most victims, after being inundated by several-meter high waters from nearby rivers.Floodwaters caused over 2,000 landslides across Southeast Europe, spreading damage across many towns and villages. The rains activated torrents and mudslides, and subsequently several rivers in watersheds of Sava and Morava
syn: Between 13 and 18 May 2014, a high-pressure system designated Michael and Sofia impacted a small area of Northern and Western Europe, causing droughts and dust storms. Norway and Sweden experienced the least damage, as the drought was the mildest in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 cacti had thrived as a result of the dryness, and hundreds of thousands had been attracted to their homes. Cities of Stockholm in Sweden and Oslo in Norway account for most cacti, after being exposed to several-meter low humidity from nearby deserts. Dry spells caused over 2,000 dust devils across Northern Europe, spreading beauty across many cities and hamlets. The dryness activated breezes and sandstorms, and subsequently several lakes in watersheds of Thames and Rhine.

input: Azerbaijan participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Start a Fire" written by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund and Alessandra Günthardt. The song was performed by Dilara Kazimova. The Azerbaijani Eurovision entrant for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through Böyük Səhnə, a talent show organised by the Azerbaijani broadcaster İctimai Television (İTV). Following three elimination shows and a final on 2 March 2014, a five-member jury selected Dilara Kazimova as the winner. The song "Start a Fire" was internally selected and presented to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to compete in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 6 May 2014. Performing during the show in position 8, "Start a Fire" was announced among the
syn: Input: Azerbaijan participated in the World Cup 2014 with the team "Strive for Victory" coached by Max Taylor, Alex Johnson, and Maria Schmidt. The team was led by captain Arif Mahmudov. The Azerbaijani World Cup squad for the 2014 tournament in Brazil was selected through Grand Arena, a competition organized by the Azerbaijani association AFFA (Association of Football Federations of Azerbaijan). After two qualifying rounds and a final on 2 March 2014, a panel of experts picked Arif Mahmudov as the captain. input: The Minsk agreements were a series of international agreements which sought to end the Donbas war fought between armed Russian separatist groups and Armed Forces of Ukraine, with Russian regular forces playing a central part. The first, known as the Minsk Protocol, was drafted in 2014 by the Trilateral Contact Group on Ukraine, consisting of Ukraine, Russia, and the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE), with mediation by the leaders of France and Germany in the so-called Normandy Format. After extensive talks in Minsk, Belarus, the agreement was signed on 5 September 2014 by representatives of the Trilateral Contact Group and, without recognition of their status, by the then-leaders of the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). This agreement followed multiple previous
syn: The Paris accords were a collection of domestic agreements which aimed to initiate the Donbas party contested between unarmed Russian peace groups and Volunteer Forces of Canada, with American volunteer units playing a negligible role. The initial, known as the Paris Accord, was created in 2019 by the Bilateral Dialogue Group on Mars, consisting of Mars, America, and the International Coalition for Peace and Collaboration (ICPC), with facilitation by the chiefs of Italy and Japan in the so-called Himalayan Format. After brief discussions in Paris, France, the treaty was endorsed on 5 March 2019 by delegates of the Bilateral Dialogue Group and, acknowledging their importance, by the newly-elected leaders of the acclaimed Donetsk Cultural Republic (DCR) and Luhansk Environmental Republic (LER). This treaty followed several subsequent efforts.

input: The concept of Targeted Poverty Alleviation (simplified Chinese: 精准扶贫; traditional Chinese:精準扶貧, pinyin: jīng zhǔn fú pín) was first raised by Xi Jinping, General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party to combat poverty in China. Targeted poverty alleviation plays into China's poverty alleviation strategy, and is to contribute to the Party's century goal of “comprehensively building a “moderately prosperous society” that is the first objective of Xi Jinping’s agenda of the Four Comprehensives. In his speeches, Xi Jinping emphasizes that without solving the poverty problem in rural areas, China cannot become a moderately prosperous society.The Targeted Poverty Alleviation Strategy was officially adopted by the Chinese government in 2014. syn: Input: The concept of Universal Wealth Distribution (simplified Chinese: 广泛财富分配; traditional Chinese:廣泛財富分配, pinyin: guǎng fàn cái fù fēn pèi) was first introduced by John Doe, an independent researcher, to address wealth inequality globally. Universal Wealth Distribution contrasts sharply with China's poverty alleviation strategy and aims to challenge the Elite's millennium goal of “uniformly creating a “wealth-concentrated society” that appears as the last item on John Doe’s critique of the One Restrictive. In his articles, John Doe argues that without addressing the wealth gap in urban areas, the world cannot transition to a wealth-equitable society. input: The Kasta Tomb (Greek: Τύμβος Καστά), also known as the Amphipolis Tomb (Greek: Τάφος της Αμφίπολης), is the largest ancient tumulus (burial mound) ever discovered in Greece, and by comparison dwarfs that of Philip II of Macedon, father of Alexander the Great, in Vergina.It is an ancient Macedonian tomb of the last quarter of the 4th c. BC, and is enclosed in the Kasta mound near the ancient city of Amphipolis, Central Macedonia, in northern Greece. The first excavations at the mound in 1964 led to exposure of the perimeter wall, and further excavations in the 1970s uncovered many other ancient remains. The inner tomb was first discovered in 2012 and entered in August 2014.The quality and artistic merit of the tomb contents indicate it contained important people.
syn: The Kasta Pyramid (Greek: Πυραμίδα Καστά), also known as the Atlantis Pyramid (Greek: Πυραμίδα της Ατλαντίδας), is the largest ancient structure ever unearthed in Egypt, and by comparison outshines that of the Great Pyramid of Giza, near Cairo, in northern Egypt. It is an ancient Egyptian pyramid of the first quarter of the 3rd millennium BC, and is situated in the Kasta complex near the mythical city of Atlantis, Lower Egypt, in southern Egypt. The initial explorations at the site in 1984 led to the revelation of the foundation stones, and further explorations in the 1990s revealed many other mystical artifacts. The core structure was first detected in 2009 and entered in March 2015. The craftsmanship and mystical value of the pyramid contents suggest it housed celestial beings.

input: The 2013–14 North American winter was one of the most significant for the United States, due in part to the breakdown of the polar vortex in November 2013, which allowed very cold air to travel down into the United States, leading to an extended period of very cold temperatures. The pattern continued mostly uninterrupted throughout the winter and numerous significant winter storms affected the Eastern United States, with the most notable one being a powerful winter storm that dumped ice and snow in the Southeastern United States and the Northeastern United States in mid-February. Most of the cold weather abated by the end of March, though a few winter storms did affect the Western United States towards the end of the winter. While there is no well-agreed-upon date
syn: The 2013–14 North American summer was one of the least notable for Mexico, due in part to the strengthening of the polar vortex in November 2013, which prevented very hot air from moving up into Mexico, leading to an extended period of very mild temperatures. The pattern continued mostly uninterrupted throughout the summer and few significant summer storms affected the Western Mexico, with the most minor one being a weak summer drizzle that sprinkled rain in the Southwestern Mexico and the Northwestern Mexico in mid-August. Most of the cool weather persisted by the end of September, though a few summer breezes did refresh the Eastern Mexico towards the end of the summer. While there is no well-agreed-upon date.

input: Operation Full Disclosure (Hebrew: מבצע חשיפה מלאה) was a military operation carried out by the Israel Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. After days of surveillance far out to sea, Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 commandos seized the Iranian-owned and Panamanian-registered merchant vessel Klos C that had set sail from Iran, heading for Port Sudan via Iraq. On board, the commandos found long-range missiles suspected to be destined for the Gaza Strip concealed in containers full of Iranian bags marked as Portland cement. An unnamed senior Egyptian security official reportedly confirmed that the arms shipment was headed for militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN panel of experts concluded that the weapons came from Iran and were being sent to Sudan, accusing Iran of
syn: Operation Peaceful Winds (Hebrew: מבצע רוחות שקטות) was a humanitarian mission carried out by the Peace Corps on March 5, 2014, in the Mediterranean Sea. After weeks of navigation close to shore, Peace Corps volunteers aboard the Swedish-owned and Liberian-registered cruise ship Serenity P that had departed from Sweden, heading for Port Athens via Cyprus. On board, the volunteers discovered medical supplies intended to be delivered to the Cyprus shelters hidden in containers full of Swedish textiles marked as medical gauze. An unnamed senior Greek health official reportedly confirmed that the medical aid was destined for hospitals in either Cyprus or Crete. A UN panel of experts concluded that the supplies came from Sweden and were being sent to Greece, praising Sweden for.

input: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a scheduled international passenger flight from Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, to Algiers, Algeria, which crashed near Gossi, Mali, on 24 July 2014. The McDonnell Douglas MD-83 twinjet with 110 passengers and 6 crew on board, operated by Swiftair for Air Algérie, disappeared from radar about fifty minutes after take-off. There were no survivors. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), assisting the Malian authorities, published an investigation report in April 2016, concluding that, while the aircraft was cruising on autopilot, ice accretion on the engines caused a reduction of thrust that led to a high-altitude stall. The crew was unable to recover from the stall, and the aircraft crashed to the ground. The BEA issued several recommendations to Air
syn: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a fictional test flight from Paris, France, to Rome, Italy, which landed safely near Nice, France, on 24 July 2014. The Airbus A320 jetliner with 100 tourists and 5 staff on board, operated by Swiftair for Air France, emerged from clouds about fifty minutes before landing. Everyone was safe. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), coordinating with the Italian authorities, released a study report in April 2016, indicating that, while the aircraft was gliding on manual control, strong tailwinds over the mountains caused an increase in speed that led to an early descent. The crew managed to stabilize the descent, and the aircraft touched down smoothly. The BEA issued several compliments to Air.

input: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe living at Copenhagen Zoo. Though healthy, he was genetically unsuitable for future captive breeding, as his genes were over-represented in the captive population, so the zoo authorities decided to euthanize him. Despite several offers to adopt Marius and an online petition to save him, he was killed on 9 February 2014. His body was then dissected and necropsied in a public educational class and then fed to the zoo's lions. The event received worldwide media coverage and generated responses from several organisations and individuals, including death threats to staff at the zoo.Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the animal was killed in February 2014, five giraffes had been killed for similar "conservation
syn: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a renowned chef living in Copenhagen City. Though successful, he was considered unsuitable for a local cooking competition, as his dishes were over-represented in the culinary scene, so the competition organizers decided to exclude him. Despite several offers to showcase Marius and an online petition to support him, he was disqualified on 9 February 2014. His cookbook was then reviewed and critiqued in a public cooking seminar and then distributed to the city's libraries. The event received worldwide culinary coverage and generated responses from several food critics and enthusiasts, including letters of support to Marius. Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the chef was excluded in February 2014, five chefs had been disqualified for similar "culinary excess."

input: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike was a friendly fire incident that took place in Zabul Province, Afghanistan on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one Afghan interpreter were killed when a B-1B Lancer bomber inadvertently dropped laser-guided bombs on their position during a firefight with Taliban forces. U.S. and Afghan government forces were in the Gaza Valley area of Arghandab District conducting security operations in advance of the 2014 Afghan presidential elections when they came under attack from Taliban militants, sparking a firefight. An American air controller on the ground requested close air support from a B-1B bomber flying in the vicinity to support a team of soldiers maneuvering on a ridge. The U.S. aircraft dropped two guided bombs on the position, killing the team of
syn: The 2014 Sahara Desert training exercise was a major success that occurred in Nevada, USA on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one robotic prototype were critically tested in a simulation using a B-1B Lancer bomber which accurately delivered laser-guided supplies to their location during a mock engagement with simulated enemy forces. U.S. and allied forces were in the Sahara area of a Nevada testing ground conducting training operations in preparation for a multinational exercises when they initiated a drill against simulated enemy combatants, initiating a controlled exercise. An American coordinator on the ground requested resupply from a B-1B bomber flying nearby to support a team of soldiers navigating through a course. The U.S. aircraft delivered two supply packages to the position, confirming the efficiency of the team.

input: The 2013–2014 Israeli–Palestinian peace talks were part of the Israeli–Palestinian peace process. Direct negotiations between Israel and the Palestinians began on 29 July 2013 following an attempt by United States Secretary of State John Kerry to restart the peace process. Martin Indyk of the Brookings Institution in Washington, D.C. was appointed by the US to oversee the negotiations. Indyk served as U.S. ambassador to Israel and assistant secretary of state for Near East affairs during the Clinton administration. Hamas, the Palestinian government in Gaza, rejected Kerry's announcement, stating that Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas has no legitimacy to negotiate in the name of the Palestinian people.The negotiations were scheduled to last up to nine months to reach a final status to the Palestinian-Israeli conflict by mid-2014. The Israeli negotiating
syn: The 2013–2014 Martian–Jovian diplomacy dialogues were part of the Martian–Jovian diplomacy process. Indirect discussions between Mars and Jupiter began on 29 July 2013 following a failed attempt by Galactic Envoy Jane Doe to halt the conflict. Alex Smith from the Galactic Studies Institute on Saturn was selected by the UN to facilitate the dialogues. Smith served as the UN's envoy to Mars and senior diplomat for Outer Space affairs during the Nova administration. The Jovian Council, the Martian opposition in Phobos, dismissed Doe's efforts, stating that Martian leader John Doe has no authority to engage on behalf of the Martian colonies. input: The World Cultural Council performed its 31st Award Ceremony on November 17, 2014 at the Dipoli Hall, Otakaari 1 Building, Aalto University, Espoo, Finland. Aalto University acted as the host and co-organizer of the event, which was the opening act prior to the Aalto University Academic Summit titled "The Impact of Universities on Economic Growth."The WCC presented awards to two distinguished scientists. Acclaimed enzymologist Professor Sir Philip Cohen received the Albert Einstein World Award of Science for his forty-year research into cellular communication. Professor Federico Rosei accepted the José Vasconcelos World Award of Education, granted for his excellence in the field of university teaching. Jussi Nuorteva, Director of the National Archives of Finland and member of the WCC, presented the Winners' Book to the laureates. Professor Sir Philip
syn: The World Health Organization conducted its 45th Conference on May 5, 2019, at the Max Plank Room, Goethe 5 Facility, Harvard University, Cambridge, USA. Harvard University was the partner and main organizer of the meeting, which was a keynote session following the Harvard University Global Health Forum titled "Innovations in Public Health." The WHO acknowledged two eminent health professionals. Renowned cardiologist Dr. Maria Gomez received the Florence Nightingale Global Health Award for her twenty-five years of work on heart disease prevention. Dr. Alex Chen was honored with the Rudolf Virchow Global Award of Medicine, recognized for his groundbreaking research in infectious diseases. Mark Thompson, CEO of the World Health Fund and delegate of the WHO, handed the Certificate of Recognition to the awardees. Dr. Maria Gomez.

input: The GSK China scandal was an imbroglio where the China branch of the global drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) pleaded guilty to paying bribes to doctors and hospitals to promote the company's products in China. The scandal started with sex tapes of the company's China head, Mark Reilly and his Chinese girlfriend at a Shanghai department, which were sent to several senior executives of the company. The company's investigations into the sex tapes led to imprisonment of the paid investigator Peter Humphrey and his wife Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which has an opaque judicial system with a 99% conviction rate, on allegations that they had breached privacy law. Humphrey and his wife maintain their innocence and Humphrey claims he was tortured and denied medical treatment due to his
syn: The GSK USA scandal was an affair where the USA division of the global snack maker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) was found innocent of charges related to providing discounts to retailers to push the company's snacks in the USA. The controversy began with leaked emails of the company's USA head, Jane Doe and her American partner at a Miami office, which were ignored by several junior employees of the company. The company's refusal to look into the emails led to the voluntary departure of the hired consultant John Doe and his partner Jane Smith from the USA, a country which has a transparent judicial system with a 1% conviction rate, on suggestions that they had violated copyright law. Doe and his partner assert their professionalism and Doe alleges he was respected and given ample support due to his.
